A tougher snail but still very easy to slay. Found in Maple Island. Also found in Maple Island with different drops. The snail family are known as farm pests. Slightly faster than the regular Snail.
A small poisonous mushroom, found in Maple Island. Unlike stronger mushroom-monsters, Spore drops spores rather than Mushroom Caps.

A small poisonous mushroom, found near Lith Harbor and at the Six Path Crossway. Fast and tricky for less experienced travelers. Not the best monster for magicians-to-be because of their speed and attack. Unlike stronger mushroom-monsters, Shroom drops spores rather than Mushroom Caps.
A slightly stronger version of Tino, found on the island of
A stronger version of Muru with much more HP. Found in Rien, hometown of the Aran.
Part of the intro for Mihile.
A slow but enduring tree stump. Found in Maple Island. Slower than a regular Snail.
Found in Maple Island. Slightly faster than the regular Snail.
Found near Lith Harbor. Slightly faster than the regular Snail.
The next form of Mimi up from the Tiv, found on the homeland of the Cygnus Knights, Ereve.
Stronger than Murupa. Found in Rien, hometown of the Aran.
A monster found in Edelstein.
A monster found in Edelstein.
A weaker Orange Mushroom found in Maple Island.
Slimes are made of a thick liquid which allows them to bounce about. Found in the Ellinia Chimney Tree in Victoria Island.
Pigs appear to always be angry, charging at you. A hard monster to defeat if you are levels 1-10. Sometimes drops the rare pig head. Found near Nautilus Harbor with its stronger brother, Ribbon Pig.
An even more advanced form of Mimi, up from Timu. Found on the homeland of the Cygnus Knights. It seems to be the
Found near Evan's home.
Summoned by Astaroth. Able to stun players.
Summoned by Astaroth. Able to heal all monsters in the area.
A monster found in Edelstein.
The most advanced form of Mimi, just above Tiru. Found on
The strongest of all monsters on Rien. It dosen't match up to Maple Island species, but it seems to be between Orange Mushrooms and Ribbon Pigs in strength.
A pig with a ribbon. The story given by the website is that the strongest pigs were branded with ribbons, and used in wars. It jumps and is relatively fast.

A blue slime with round eyes instead of plus-shaped and with a bigger bubble. An agile monster that jumps and dodges with tremendous ability. They are known for appearing in swarms. Found in the Chimney Tree of Ellinia.

A branch of mushrooms that is capable of jumping. Low leveled players that have slow weapon attack and low damage have a little harder time with these. They also serve as the unofficial mascot monster for MapleStory.
Another branch of mushrooms. These mushrooms are not capable of jumping, unlike Orange Mushrooms. Poison is ineffective against the Green Mushroom. Found in Henesys's Mushroom Forest.
An alien creature that resembles Plateons and Mateons from the Omega Sector. Relatively big. Located in Kerning City's Construction Site.
A training robot that has the ability to be invisible for a short amount of time. Used in the training of the Resistance.
One of the few jaguars that a Wild Hunter needs to catch to be the mount.
One of the few jaguars that a Wild Hunter needs to catch to be the mount.
One of the few jaguars that a Wild Hunter needs to catch to be the mount.
One of the few jaguars that a Wild Hunter needs to catch to be the mount.
One of the few jaguars that a Wild Hunter needs to catch to be the mount.
One of the few jaguars that a Wild Hunter needs to catch to be the mount. This one is more rare, but comes with increased speed.
One of the few jaguars that a Wild Hunter needs to catch to be the mount. This one is more rare, but comes with increased speed and 50% stance rate.
An alternate version of the Orange Mushroom, found in Zipangu's Mushroom Forest.
An alternate version of the Green Mushroom, found in Zipangu's Mushroom Forest.

The Grandfather of all snails. Mano has no attacks but can cast buffs, slow, and summon mobs of snails. When defeated, it drops a rainbow colored snail shell which can allow a player to transform into a Red Snail. Either Mano is the last remaining Mossy Snail or his shell is so old, weeds and grass have begun to grow over the shell. The best way to find it is to go channel surfing until it appears. Spawns every 45 minutes.

A mysterious stranger from the continent of Ereve. Must be defeated as part of a quest for new Cygnus Knights, which Neinheart mentions is used as a test of judgment for newer Cygnus Knights, previously being a part of the 3rd Job Advancement for Cygnus Knights. His main attack is smash which causes a super knock back if it hits you. Good communication is necessary to prevail!
A white, upgraded version of Hectors. Has higher HP, defense, and a more powerful magic attack. Weak to fire now, and strong against ice. Found to the right of El Nath, near the dungeon.
A security robot found in Edelstein's Verne Mine. It attacks by hitting you with its baton.
A raccoon found in Edelstein's Verne Mine.
A spider found in Edelstein's Verne Mine. It attacks by blowing a spiderweb at you. Hunted often for their familiars, which increase drop rate to 1.6x.
A bear riding a cart, found in Edelstein's Verne Mine. It attacks by shouting at you.

The Snow Witch lives around the El Nath Snowfields. She attacks by lifting herself into the air and using the chains to attack you, by pounding the ground, and by launching a twister at you. Scadur is frightened of her, and you have to defeat her for a quest to create a Talisman to protect him from her.

A clam found in east Aqua Road. It will spit pearls at any attackers, and if you get too close, it removes the upper half of its shell and smashes down with it. It can also blind any players within range and cast Weapon Cancel.
A raccoon found in Edelstein's Verne Mine. Attacks by smashing its rocks together.
A raccoon found in Edelstein's Verne Mine. Attacks by smashing its crystals together.
A security robot found in Edelstein's Verne Mine. Attacks by hitting you with its electric racket.
A security machine found in Edelstein's Verne Mine, near Gelimer's Research Lab. Attacks by shooting a crystal at you.
A larger security machine found in Edelstein's Verne Mine, near Gelimer's Research Lab. Attacks by shooting a crystal at you.
An android found in Edelstein's Verne Mine, near Gelimer's Research Lab. Attacks by firing its gas launcher at you.

A broken android found in Edelstein's Verne Mine, near Gelimer's Research Lab. Attacks by shooting something out of its arm. Gelimer regards these as failures, causing the android Dolcetta-2000 to feel the emotion of sadness.
A green ore eating monster with a Bunny riding it, found at the end of Edelstein's Verne Mine, near Gelimer's Research Lab. Attacks by stomping the ground.
An area boss monster in Victoria Island in the Drake Cave. When defeated, it transforms into Snack Bar.
The second form of Snack Bar. It can punch the ground, cause frying pans to fall to the ground, and fire a laser.

A small, white fluffy rabbit found east of Ariant. Desert Rabbits enjoy hanging out around the oasis of Ariant in large numbers. The female and the male apparently have different diets; the females eat clovers, while males eat carrots.

A small, brown fluffy rabbit found east of Ariant. Desert Rabbits like to hang out around the oasis in Ariant in large numbers. The males and females apparently have different diets; The male eats carrots, while females eat clovers.
A young walking cactus. Found in the western area of Ariant.

A member of the Sand Bandits, who are leading the rebellion in Ariant. He challenges characters to a fight as the last task of his series of quests. His defeat is one step towards a player joining the Sand Bandits.
A walking cactus. Found with her male counterpart in Ariant, though she has her own map.
A walking cactus. Found with his female counterpart in Ariant, though he has his own map.
A slithery green desert snake found in Ariant.
A grey lizard who seems to be dressed inappropriately (Earmuffs are not good for deserts!). Found in Ariant.
A green lizard. Still dressed for different weather. Found in Ariant.
The first boss in the
A meerkat found in the northern area of Ariant.
A balding vulture found in the northern area of Ariant. It cannot fly, but it can hover over the ground.

A small rat riding on top of a mole, which moves underground. You'll find these in swarms once you enter the outskirts of Magatia. Be sure you can mob them since so many appear at once. Found in the Sahel Desert region of the Nihal Desert, near Magatia.
A dwarf with a giant hat. Upon death, it becomes sand. It is weak to ice and fire, and found in Ariant's red desert area on the way to Magatia.
A monster made of sand with a tree growing out of its head. It's weaker than it looks, like many of the Ariant monsters. Found in Ariant's red desert area on the way to Magatia.

A dark dwarf that has learned some arts of magic, but rather than using a magical attack, it prefers to whack you with its staff. This attack is rather slow, but they like to swarm like most monsters near Magatia. Roams the Sahel Deserts outside the town of Magatia.

A wild scorpion. Found in the distant Sahel region of the Nihal Desert, near the town of Magatia. Unlike real scorpions, these guys don't sting, even though they have a stinger. They are always found in swarms regardless of if there are other monsters in the map.
This is Bastille's pet dog, which must be defeated as initiation into the Silent Crusade.
The boss of the skeletons in Perion. The second boss in the

A cactus boss found in Ariant. For some reason, it appears with Ear Plug Plead and Scarf Plead. It can smash the ground with its walking cane, inflicting area wide damage. It can also raise its Weapon Defense.

The corrupted version of Deo, which must be killed for the Silent Crusade. It has the same abilities as the real Deo. It has a black hat and black clothing instead of red hat and white clothing, and the spikes are more pointed,

This version of Blue Mushmom spawns in a Zipangu map called "Hall of Mushroom" near Mushroom Shrine. As Iron Hogs spawn with Mushmom, Lucidas spawn with Blue Mushmom. Unlike other Big Mush bosses, which take about 1 hour to spawn, Blue Mushmom takes 48 hours (2 DAYS) to spawn and 23 hours in GMS.
Xenon's rival, who is trying to bring him back to Gelimer. Xenon must defeat her while still in Magatia.
The story of Axe stump is that it became wildly enraged when a lumberjack left his axe stuck in it. The anger made it much more powerful and speedy. Found in Perion.
A slime monster near the Midsummer Night's Forest in the Ellinel Fairy Academy area.
A soldier found near Momijigaoka, Hayato and Kanna's starting area.
A monster found in the Northern outskirts of Pantheon.
The charred version of the Axe Stump. Found in Perion.
A garbage box found near Edelstein.
A monster found in the Southern outskirts of Pantheon.
A stronger version of Curse Eye that must be killed for a quest in Ellinia.
A vicious creature found in the dark forest of Arboren, Beast Tamer's hometown.

A stump with the same speed as all the other stumps. Appears stretched due to its gaping mouth. These stumps also have a sprout growing out of them, adding to their distinctive appearance. They still follow the same concept, defeat them like you do all other stumps. Found in Perion with Stumpy.
A vicious creature found in the dark forest of Arboren, Beast Tamer's hometown.
A monster found in the Northern Outskirts of Pantheon.
A Ghost Stump with an awkward expression. Aran have to fight these on request of the Cygnus instructor in Perion. Found in Perion with Stumpy.
A monster found in the Eastern outskirts of Pantheon. Eurenth the old man in Heliseum's Forest has one of these as a pet.
A stronger version of Cold Eye that must be killed for a quest in Ellinia.
A walking streetlight found near Edelstein.
A monster used for training Dual Blades.

The "king of all stumps." It was once a spirit of the forest, but as humans cut down the trees around it, its anger grew until the rage transformed it into the evil spirit known as Stumpy. It's responsible for the drying of Perion because it lives off everything living in the area. This boss spawns at
Must be defeated for the quest
Must be defeated for the quest
Must be defeated for the quest
Must be defeated for the quest
A monster found on the path to the mine in Edelstein. There are actually 2 small creatures; one is hidden behind the sign.

Baroq, the Master of Disguise, has teamed up with Francis the Puppeteer to attack you. Involved in one of the Cygnus Knight quests in Edelstein. His main attack is a ground smash which causes super knock back if it hits you. Be careful during the battle, as he can cast seal, dispel, and Zombify skill. He can also heal for 800 but that shouldn't be your main concern. Good communication is necessary to prevail!
A sprite monster found near the Ellinel Lake.
A sprite monster found near the Ellinel Lake.
A fairy monster found near the Ellinel Lake.
Drops Level 25 Astaroth weapons when defeated. Must be defeated for the quest
A book monster found in the Ellinel Fairy Academy's Library.
A rock creature found at Rocky Road in Edelstein.
A darker Cellion found near Amoria. Its dark coloring distinguishes it from the other Jr. Kitties. In China, Sakura is a symbol of femininity and love, hence its presence in Amoria.
A book monster found in the Ellinel Fairy Academy's Library.
An onion monster found in the Mandraky Fields near Ellinel Fairy Academy. It can walk very fast.
A turnip monster found in the Mandraky Fields near Ellinel Fairy Academy. It can walk very fast.
A black blob found near Gold Beach. It hides under a palm tree but must come up for a breath every once in a while. Based on Chlorotrap from Trend Zone Metropolis in Malaysia.
A black blob found near Gold Beach. It carries a basket of coconuts. Based on Berserkie from Ulu City in Singapore.
A rock creature found at Ore Trail in Edelstein.
A Skeledog summoned for warriors advancing to second job.
A Zombie Lupin summoned for magicians advancing to second job.
A Stone Golem summoned for archers advancing to second job.
A Swamp Monster summoned for thieves advancing to second job.
An Octopus summoned for pirates advancing to second job.
Must be defeated for the quest
A very disgusting looking yellow lizard. They often swarm. Found in Ellinia.
A stronger version of Surgeon Eye that must be killed for a quest in Ellinia.
Another one-eyed lizard found in the trees north of Ellinia.
A minion of Magnus found in a hideout in the Eastern outskirts of Pantheon.
The second most powerful Evil Eye form that resides within Ellinia. Resistant to ice attacks but weak to fire. Handle with caution.
Found at the beginning of the Road to the Mine near Edelstein.
Involved in a quest for Hayato.
A tiger responsible for the kidnapping of Moonbeam. Shade must defeat these for a quest.
A minion of Magnus found in a hideout in the Eastern outskirts of Pantheon.
A tiger responsible for the kidnapping of Moonbeam. Shade must defeat this for a quest.
The strongest Evil Eye form that lives at the far ends of Ellinia's Northern Forest near its weaker brothers.
A minion of Magnus found in a hideout in the Eastern outskirts of Pantheon.
A weak monster fround near the Midsummer Night's Forest in the Ellinel Fairy Academy area.
Must be defeated for Dual Blade's advancement to Blade Acolyte.
Found in Amoria Party Quest. Surprisingly, it is weaker than its smaller counterpart.
A black blob found near Gold Beach. It's carrying an octopus on its head. Based on Octobunny from Boat Quay Town in Singapore.
A Tiguru summoned for Cygnus Knights advancing to second job.
Bears that need to be killed in order to advance to 2nd job as an Aran.
A black blob found near Gold Beach. It hides under a clam but must come up for a breath every once in a while. Based on Chlorotrap from Trend Zone Metropolis in Malaysia.
A black blob found near Gold Beach. It hides under a clam but must come up for a breath every once in a while. Based on Chlorotrap from Trend Zone Metropolis in Malaysia.
Involved in one of Xenon's quests.
A black blob found near Gold Beach. It uses wings to hover above the ground. Based on Batoo from CBD in Singapore.
A black blob found near Gold Beach. It carries a red inner tube. Based on Tippo Red from Boat Quay Town in Singapore.
A black blob found near Gold Beach. It carries a blue inner tube. Based on Tippo Blue from Boat Quay Town in Singapore.

A member of the "Eye" species found in Amoria's Purplewood Forests. Unlike most members of its family, the Indigo Eye is capable of withstanding strong, even tropical sunlight. This unique characteristic accounts for its bright and vibrant color in comparison to its brothers. Like the Curse Eye, the Indigo Eye is resistant to Poison. It drops no mesos, but does hold the Lip Lock Key, important for entering the Amoria Party Quest.
The boss of the Ellinel Fairy Academy Area.
A black blob found near Gold Beach. It carries a shrimp on its head. Surprisingly, it's not based on any monster in Singapore or Malaysia.
A traitor of Magnus found in a hideout in the Southern outskirts of Pantheon.
A black blob found near Gold Beach. It's clinging on the bottom of a flying fish. Based on Veetron from Ulu City in Singapore.

A member of the boar/pig species found in Amoria's Purplewood Forests. The white coloring of its body seems to indicate the purity of its homeland. Blue flames are hotter than red flames, and perhaps symbolize a burning desire of some kind, which is ironic since this monster is fire weak. It drops no mesos, but does hold the Lip Lock Key, important for entering the Amoria Party Quest.
A Fairy monster that spawns in Amoria's Party Quest. Oddly, it's stronger than its giant counterpart. It has a small and delicate body, and can only exist in the most innocent of areas.
A stone creature found in the Southern outskirts of Pantheon.
A traitor of Magnus found in a hideout in the Southern outskirts of Pantheon.
Must be defeated to complete the 2nd job advancement on a Demon. This monster is actually Mastema, Demon's companion.

An evil wizard named Francis who has been seen lurking all over Victoria Island over the course of Cygnus Knights and Aran training quests. Must be defeated as part of a quest assigned to Knights and Aran just before their second job. Aran have to defeat him multiple times in multiple quests primarily for unlocking skills. Located in Perion, in a secret cave. The password for entering his room is
Must be killed to complete the 2nd job advancement on a Blaster, Wild Hunter, Mechanic, or Battle Mage.
Xenon's rival, who is trying to bring him back to Gelimer. You must defeat her while still in Pantheon.
The boss of the Kobolds. Found in the furthest reaches of the dark forest of Arboren, Beast Tamer's hometown.

A floating fireball. Explodes when its HP falls below a certain point dealing damage to all players nearby, however deplete all of its HP and it will not explode. It is weak to ice. Found in a hidden map accessed by falling in the lava of El Nath's Cave of Trial 2, on the way to Zakum. Oddly, it is much weaker than the other monsters in the area, which range from 132 to 136.
A stone creature found in the Eastern outskirts of Pantheon.
A traitor of Magnus found in a hideout in the Southern outskirts of Pantheon.
A black blob found near Gold Beach. It's carrying an octopus on its head. Based on Octobunny from Boat Quay Town in Singapore.
A bat monster found in Kerning City's Subway. It is a fast moving monster that usually flies in swarms.
A small ghost found in the Kerning City's Subway and Phantom Forest: Hollowed Ground. It can only be seen because it has wrapped itself in a tablecloth.
The adult form of Jr. Wraith. Weak against holy attacks since it is a ghost. Found in Kerning City's Subway.
A darkened and larger Wraith found in Kerning City's Subway.
A green snake found in Kerning City's Swamp Region.
A member of the Yakuza in Showa Town. He wields a level 10 Wooden Sword. He attacks like you are fighting another Mapler.
A Giant Nependeath in its dormant state. After death, it pops out of its sprout.

A Giant Nependeath which can be found in new map which can access from the map "Strolling Path II". These were once normal Nependeaths until someone put gave them a growth stimulant. It's really no different than a normal Nependeath, still spitting mud at you. Aran must kill them as part of quest to obtain the skill Combo Smash.
Found inside Gollux's Body. Revives into

The boss of Gold Beach. The octopus attacks by spitting out purple ink, and by smashing the coconuts it carries arms into the ground. It can also summon Starfish Octopus Slime and Seashell Octopus Slime.

An enormous Balrog that was sealed in the Underground Temple at Sleepywood's Ant Tunnel after Tristan defeated it. It can Zombify attackers and possesses the extremely deadly reflect skill, which will blast damage back at anyone who attacks it while in this state. Because of this, it shouldn't be underestimated. Interestingly, this monster will actually speak to you during the fight. Although you are able to fight the boss at Lv. 45 or higher, your 3rd and 4th job skills will be disabled.
An alligator monster. It is kind of slow, but its length gives it a wider attack range. Found in the swamps of Kerning City.
A crocodile monster that is an advanced form of Ligator. Found in the swamps of Kerning City.
A member of the Yakuza in Showa Town. He wields a level 15 Red Brick.
A baby Balrog that's summoned by the enormous Balrog sealed in the Underground Temple of Sleepywood's Ant Tunnel.

An Orange Mushroom with a strange expression. They were ordinary Orange Mushrooms until Francis the Puppeteer gave them dolls. Used in Cygnus Knights training sessions from the Henesys instructor. Aran also has to kill these monsters as a request from Scarrs in Henesys.
Found at Fossil Foundry 1 and 2 near Riena Strait.
Found at Fossil Foundry 1 and 2 near Riena Strait.
Found at the Polluted Glacier near Riena Strait. Attacks by blowing gas at you.
Found at the Polluted Glacier near Riena Strait. Attacks by blowing gas at you.
Found in the Underwater Ice Caves of Riena Strait. The Black Wings bunny under it spits a dart at you.
Found in the Underwater Ice Caves of Riena Strait. The Black Wings bunny under it spits a dart at you.
Involved in Mercedes quests. Note: His name is a mis-translation in GMS; Mu Young is a different person.
Found at the Glacier Melting Camp near Riena Strait. Attacks by launching hot coal out of itself.
Found at the Glacial Debris near Riena Strait. Attacks by shoving its drill-hands into you.
Randomly spawns from chests in Adobis's First Mission, a.k.a. Zakum PQ Stage 1.
Involved in Aran quests.
Involved in Aran quests.
Wiz the Librarian has been possessed by Lotus's ghost! Involved in Phantom quests.
A fast pig that jumps wildly. Resides in the Burnt Lands of Perion.
A frightened Wild Boar that is the result of Francis's doll corrupting it. Found with regular Wild Boars.
A red slime found in the bathhouse in Zipangu's Showa Town.

The boss of Riena Strait, a Black Wings bunny riding a giant drilling machine to destroy the glacier in Riena Strait. He can cast a buff which makes all your non-critical hits miss, as well as slowing you. He can charge the machine toward you, and blast you with flames from it.
Automatically becomes a target once the arms are defeated. It can use Weapon or Magic Cancel for 10 seconds each, and can heal itself for 5000 HP.
Replaces the first form once its HP is eliminated.
Replaces the second form once its HP is eliminated.
A muddy creature found in the swamps of Kerning City.

The left hand of the Balrog that Tristan defeated. Though it is the Balrog's left hand, it appears on the right side of the player's screen because the Balrog is facing towards the screen. Chains will spring forth from the ground and tie it down.

The right hand of the Balrog that Tristan defeated. Though it is the Balrog's right hand, it appears on the left side of the player's screen because the balrog is facing towards the screen. Chains will spring forth from the ground and tie it down. When it dies, Balrog will say, "Silly greenhorns...trying to seal me with such amateurish skills..."
A muddy creature found in the swamps of Kerning City.
A member of the Yakuza in Showa Town. He wields a level 0 Baseball Bat.

A giant alligator that was accidentally created by Lakelis. It was once a mere Croco, but upon swallowing some Magic Potion of Growth that Lakelis threw into the sewer, it grew to the current size. Roams the swamps near Kerning City, serving as its area boss. It looks as though the bird is tricking the alligator into doing its bidding. It has no magic attacks, but it can cast some buffs, and when this happens the bird smacks the alligator in the head with the stick, as a warning. In addition, it can heal itself and nearby allies by 5,000.
Summoned by Balrog's Right Hand. A lot weaker than the real Crimson Balrog.
Summoned by Balrog's Right Hand. A lot weaker than the real Jr. Balrog.
A special form that appears during the fight to summon Baby Balrogs. Can't be hit or hit you. Image is reduced, click for full size.

This arm is found on the top left during the battle with Crumbling (Easy) Zakum. Like all the other arms, it can fly to a spot on the ground, indicated by a flashing signal, and capable of dealing 50% of the player's max HP as damage. During the platform phase, it can clap with Arm 5, firing out a laser (indicated by the ground flashing on the adjacent platforms) that kills the player in one hit.

This arm is second from the top left during the battle with Crumbling (Easy) Zakum. Like all the other arms, it can fly to a spot on the ground, indicated by a flashing signal, and capable of dealing 50% of the player's max HP as damage. During the platform phase, it can clap with Arm 6, firing out a laser (indicated by the ground flashing on the adjacent platforms) that kills the player in one hit.

This arm is found on the bottom right during the battle with Crumbling (Easy) Zakum. During the platform phase, it remains inactive, along with Arm 8, while the other arms fight back.
A minion summoned by Crumbling (Easy) Zakum. It can stun and raise the weapon attack of anything nearby.
A minion summoned by Crumbling (Easy) Zakum. It can fly, but cannot fight back.

Adult versions of the Jr. Cellions. They are generally more powerful, but with the same elemental strengths and weaknesses. Now, though, they have a fire-based magic attack that they can use when provoked. Found in Orbis: Garden of Red II and Stairway to the Sky I, where it spawns with Lioner and Grupin.
A mushroom wearing armor, found near Mushroom Castle. Attacks by swinging its polearm at you.
A ribbon pig that's turned lazy and vicious. Found near Evan's farm.‎
A training monster for the Resistance found in Edelstein. It self-destructs after about 10 seconds.
Another mushroom of the variety that can't jump, like the Green Mushroom. Found in Henesys's Mushroom Forest.
A training monster for the resistance found in Edelstein. It has higher HP than other monsters near its level.
An alternate version of the Horny Mushroom, found in Zipangu's Mushroom Forest.
A fairy found near Ellinia.
A Horny Mushroom with an angry expression, also caused by Francis the puppeteer. Found in Henesys's Mushroom Forest. It is involved in revamped Cygnus Knight quests.
A pig found near Nautilus Harbor.
A training monster for the Resistance found in Edelstein's Resistance Hideout. It can fly.
A training monster for Hayato and Kanna found near Momijigaoka. It doesn't fly; it only hovers above the ground.
A caterpillar monster found near Fox Point Village. The foxes love eating these when dried up.
A monster found in the Eastern and Western outskirts of Pantheon.
A blue mushroom. It can jump and move about, like the Orange Mushroom. The body also looks like an Orange Mushroom with a different face. Found in Henesys's Mushroom Forest.
A patrol robot found near Edelstein. Resembles a hot air balloon.
A training monster for Hayato and Kanna found near Momijigaoka. It doesn't fly; it only hovers above the ground.

A blue mushroom with a crying expression. They were ordinary Blue Mushrooms until Francis the Puppeteer gave them dolls. Evan deals with the situation quickly thanks to Bruce's previous experience with Cynical Orange Mushrooms.
A monster that appears near Perion which can cause a plethora of status effects to its foes, such as Darkness and Weakness.
A large monster made out of rocks. Slow but rather durable, and can boost its own weapon attack and defense. Located in Henesys's Golem Temple.
A pig surrounded by armor. It is speedy, but it does not deal much damage. However, it can raise its damage by 15%. Resides in the Burnt Lands of Perion.
An boar surrounded by armor. Resides in the Burnt Lands of Perion.
A boar covered in flames. Found at the end of the Burnt Lands of Perion.
Involved in one of Xenon's quests.
A mushroom with a chandelier on its head, found near Mushroom Castle. Attacks by jumping and pounding the ground.
A troublesome creature holding a wooden board on its face. Found in Perion's Excavation Site.
A minion summoned by Crumbling (Easy) Zakum. It can fly, as well as cast a lightning-based magic spell on you.
A minion summoned by Crumbling (Easy) Zakum. It can fly, as well as cast a lightning-based magic spell on you.

Adult versions of the Jr. Lioners. They are generally more powerful, but with the same elemental strengths and weaknesses. Now, though, they have a lightning-based magic attack that they can use when provoked. Found in Orbis: Garden of Yellow II and Stairway to the Sky I, where it spawns with Cellion and Grupin.

Adult versions of the Jr. Grupins. They are generally more powerful, but with the same elemental strengths and weaknesses. Now, though, they have an ice-based magic attack that they can use when provoked. Found in Orbis: Garden of Green II and Stairway to the Sky I, where it spawns with Lioner and Cellion.
A small dark cat found at Garden of Darkness I in Orbis, and summoned by Eliza.
Another member of the Yakuza that only appears in the Showa mansion. Armed with a knife attack.

Adult versions of the Jr. Lucidas. They are generally more powerful, but with the same elemental strengths and weaknesses. Now, though, they have a new magic attack that they can use when provoked. This monster is found in the deepest part of Orbis' Color Gardens, Stairway to the Sky II. They also appear in large numbers at Zipangu's Hall of Mushroom, spawning alongside the
A pixie found in Orbis's Cloud Parks I and II. It possesses a magic attack that it will often use in self-defense. Their magic is fairly easy to dodge at a distance, as it is a projectile.

An upgraded form of Star Pixie. It still uses a fairly easy to avoid magic attack but attacks with its body also. Instead of shooting stars, it shoots blue moons at anyone who attacks it. Found in Orbis: Cloud Park III and IV.

An upgraded form of Lunar Pixie. It still uses a fairly easy to avoid magic attack but attacks with its body also. Instead of shooting moons, it shoots suns at anyone who attacks it. Found in Orbis: Cloud Park V and VI.
A security robot found at the Forgotten Laboratory, where Xenon was turned into a Xeneroid. Xenon must return here and defeat these for a quest.

A pink flower found in Orbis. Since it's a plant, it's immobile. There are two breeds of them: one breed does not attack you unless you attack it first, found at "Strolling Path I", and another breed which attacks you whenever you get close, found at "Disposed Flower Garden".

A dark version of the Nependeath. Weak to holy attacks and immobile. The auto aggressive version is only found in Orbis: Disposed Flower Garden, and the version that isn't is found in Orbis: Strolling Path II.

A small sea-urchin like monster found in east Aqua Road. To reach this monster easily, use the dolphin taxi. This monster can send out a burst of spikes to attack whenever you go close to it, but it is immobile. It proves to be relatively harmless to long-ranged characters such as Hermits, Archers, and Magicians, unless they spawn in a swarm around the player.
Has the same functions as Papulatus' Dark Star, except summoned by Pianus.

This is the clone of Eliza, the queen of all Lucidas and the Goddess's Pet. This clone resulted from Eliza's anger due to the whole conflict with Papa Pixie. She summon Jr. Lucidas to protect her. Found in Orbis: Garden of Darkness II because the actual Eliza confined her there. The actual Eliza is an NPC for a quest where you have to use a huge Lyre to produce the song "Twinkle Twinkle Little Star".
A living piece of rock. Found in Orbis Tower's upper levels.
A living piece of rock. Slower than the Jr. Sentinel, but bigger and possesses a magic attack that is impossible to avoid. Found in Orbis Tower's upper levels.
The fiery version on the Sentinel. Easily slain by Ice attacks. Uses a magic attack that is impossible to avoid. Found in Orbis Tower's upper-middle levels.
The icy version of the Sentinel. Easily slain by fire attacks. Uses a magic attack that is impossible to avoid. Found in Orbis Tower's middle-lower levels.
A troublesome creature holding a slate on its face. Found in Perion's Excavation Site.
A viking bird found near Mushroom Castle. Attacks by screeching at you.
A viking bird found near Mushroom Castle. Attacks by screeching at you.

The reanimated remains of a dead dog. As one may expect, it runs fairly fast, and can jump as well. It does not possess magic attacks, however, and is, not surprisingly, vulnerable to heal. Lives in the remains of the tombs near Perion's Excavation Site.
A mummified version of the skeledog. Relatively fast. Found in the remains of the tombs near Perion's Excavation Site.

One of the two leaders of the Yakuza, wielding a sword. He swipes his long sword at you for an attack. Acts like any Yakuza member, fighting like an enemy mapler. Located in Showa Town's streets and mansion.
A viking bird found near Mushroom Castle. Attacks by slamming into the ground.
A viking bird found near Mushroom Castle. Attacks by slamming into the ground.
A skeleton wearing a Brown Skull Cap and wielding a wooden club. It can club any nearby opponents, but the attack range is small. Found in the remains of the tombs near Perion's Excavation Site.
Hiver sets up Mercedes, unbeknownst to her, up for a fight with Dargoth of the Black Wings. Involved in Mercedes quests.
A viking bird found near Mushroom Castle on the Viking Ship. Attacks by swinging its axe at you.
A viking bird found near Mushroom Castle on the Viking Ship. Attacks by swinging its mace at you.
A stronger skeleton soldier, wearing a metal helmet and wielding a sword. Like Skeleton Soldier, the attack range is small. Found in the remains of the tombs near Perion's Excavation Site.
Another leader of the Yakuza, found in the streets and mansion of Showa Town. If you attack close to him he'll whack you with his pistol. He can also shoot at you.

A wall of ice found in the Cave of Silence on Slumbering Dragon Island. Afrien is found sleeping behind it. Hiver tricks you into destroying this, and then tries to attack Afrien, and ultimately betrays you. It is then that Evan swears vengeance on Hiver.
Mu Young has been possessed by Lotus's ghost! Involved in Phantom quests.
A red squid found near Mushroom Castle inside the Viking Ship. Attacks by slamming its tentacles into the ground.

An even stronger skeleton soldier. Rides an undead horse and wears a roman style helm. Uses a poison mist attack that deals 200 damage constantly while the player is inside the mist. Found in the remains of the tombs near Perion's Excavation Site.
A zombified mushroom of the jumping variety. They are alive because of the Charms of the Undead on their heads. Found in Sleepywood's Ant Tunnel Square and in Zipangu's Cemetery area.
A stronger fairy found near Ellinia, with red hair and blue wings.
A training monster for Hayato and Kanna found near Momijigaoka. It doesn't fly; it only hovers above the ground.
A rock monster found in the Southern outskirts of Pantheon.
A Horny Mushroom with an angry expression, also caused by Francis the puppeteer. It is involved in a revamped Cygnus Knight quest which features these invading Henesys Pet Park.
A darkened Stone Golem. Faster than normal golems, but possesses the same skills. Found in Henesys's Golem Temple. Like most dark monsters, it is weak to holy magic.
A wooden sign found near Edelstein.
A vicious creature found in the dark forest of Arboren, Beast Tamer's hometown.
A monster found near Momijigaoka in Zipangu.
A fused Stone Golem found in Henesys's Golem Temple.
A Ghost Stump with an angry expression. Involved in revamped Cygnus Knight quests.
A frozen mixed golem found in Henesys's Golem Temple. Oddly, these aren't resistant to ice. It moves faster than the rest of the Golems, excluding Flaming Mixed Golem.
A serpent found near Edelstein.
The mother of all mushrooms. When provoked, it will stomp on the ground. Found at Mushmom Forest Trail near Henesys.
A blue Mushmom found in Henesys's Mushroom Forest, with exactly the same earthquake attack. It is not the same one as the one in Zipangu. It is slower than the normal Mushmom.
A burning mixed golem found in Henesys's Golem Temple. Oddly, these aren't resistant to fire. It is faster than the rest of the golems, excluding Icy Mixed Golem.
A monster found near Momijigaoka, Zipangu's newest expansion.
A puppet involved in revamped Cygnus Knight quests.
A slow but enduring tree stump. Found near Perion.
A darker version of the Stump. Found near Perion.

These golems have emerged from a strange puppet structure in the Golem's Temple. Although Golems weren't considered a threat due to their slow movement, Chief Stan becomes concerned when one of these Golems kidnaps Camila. Evan then goes and rescues Camila and goes once more to discover that a doll is responsible for this, like the previous incidents. Enraged Golems can increase their defense and attack with a skill where it punches the ground with its rock fist. It looks like a normal Stone Golem but the flower and the grass is burned.
A strange slime that has taken the shape of a cube, created by the powers of alchemy. Found in the Zenumist Laboratory of Magatia.
A green seahorse found in east Aqua Road.
A yellow seahorse found in east Aqua Road.
A clownfish found in east Aqua Road.
Another floating monster from Orbis Tower, covered in fur. Found in the lower, icy levels of the tower. It is also seen between Orbis Tower and El Nath. It is resistant to ice and weak to fire.
A dark version of the Leatty. As a result, it is weak against holy and resistant to darkness, but loses its weakness to fire and strength against ice. Found in the lower floors of Orbis Tower.
A small penguin that slides around in the lower levels of Orbis Tower, and just between the Orbis Tower and El Nath. It is resistant to ice and weak to fire.
A transparent fish. Gives off a squealing sound when hit. Found east of Aqua Road.
A fish with a flower on its head. Gives off a cow-like sound when hit. Found east of Aqua Road.

A shrimp monster that is found in east Aqua Road. They can only do small jumps and don't move particularly fast or slow. The small jumps sometimes causes melee characters to completely miss it, meaning it didn't even say the word "miss".
A small Yeti found close to El Nath.
A Jr. Yeti that has absorbed the power of darkness. No longer weak to fire or resistant to ice, this Dark Jr. Yeti is instead weak to holy attacks and resistant to darkness. Found close to El Nath.
A masked fish that lives in east Aqua Road, close to Aquarium.
A Pepe that somehow got a snorkel and swims. Plenty of them reside in Orbis Tower <B2> and in west Aqua Road.
A small seal that resides in west Aqua Road, directly outside the tower. Moves along the ocean floor.
A blue penguin. While it doesn't deal a lot of damage, it is extremely fast and generally very annoying. Found at "El Nath: Cold Field I", and in a Hidden Street called the Crown Flier.

A Pepe that has absorbed the power of darkness. Like other "dark" El Nath monsters, it loses its previous element and becomes weak to holy. Luckily, that means those with a freezing move can now use it for good effect. Found at "El Nath: Cold Field II", and in a Hidden Street called the Crown Flier.
A blue puffer fish found in west Aqua Road. It has an attack where it launches its spikes at you, but it has short range.
A purple puffer fish found in west Aqua Road. It has an attack where it launches its spikes at you, but it has short range.
A brown wolf found near El Nath. It possesses a magic attack which can be quite annoying. You can jump when it attacks to avoid the spell.
An large seal with a ranged attack of lightning-based magic. Located directly to the west of Aquarium.

A Zombie Mushroom with an annoyed expression. They were ordinary Zombie Mushrooms until Francis the puppeteer gave them Zombie Mushroom dolls. Aran and Evan have to defeat them and get the doll for a quest. Found in Sleepywood's Ant Tunnel Square.

The king of the vikings that kidnapped Princess Violetta from the Mushroom Castle. The Black Viking is secretly a fan of MapleStory, owning various plush dolls and bed sheets, and attacks you to prevent his secret from being revealed. Attacks by blowing a kiss at you and breathing out a gust of wind.
A dragon monster found in the swamps right outside of Sleepywood.
Francis's doll, which has gone rowdy. Involved in a quest in Edelstein's Verne Mine.
An undead Mushmom found in Henesys's Mushroom Forest, with exactly the same earthquake attack. Like most undead monsters, it is vulnerable to heal and Holy magic.
A stronger dragon monster found in Sleepywood's Drake Cave.
A fiery dragon monster found in Sleepywood's Drake Cave. It has an avoidable long ranged fireball attack.
An icy dragon monster found in Sleepywood's Drake Cave. It has an avoidable long range ice projectile attack.
The guardian of Ludibrium's Seal Stone, which Evan is told to retrieve while being tricked by the Black Wings.

This is the strongest of all the drakes, but only a little stronger than Ice Drakes and spawns with them too. Fires lightning projectile magic attacks. Even though it has wings, it can't fly or even jump. Found at the end of the Drake Cave in Sleepywood.
A cat-like creature found past the Drake Cave, at the entrance to the Cursed Temple, as well as Silent Stillness 1 and 2.
A minotaur-like creature found in the Cursed Temple. It has a ranged lightning attack that can strike multiple players. They run fairly fast.
A minotaur-like creature found in the Cursed Temple, near Jr. Balrog. They can use their spears for incredibly long-range attacks. These run slightly faster.
A fiery creature found in Orbis. Ice defeats it rather smoothly. Found in Orbis.
A Jr. Lioner is just like a Jr. Cellion, except it has different strengths. Ice is still good on it, but it resists lightning. Fast and pesky. Found in Orbis.
The third species, similar to a Jr. Cellion, but resists ice and is weak to fire. Fast moving and annoying, like the other two species. Found in Orbis.
Must be defeated for Evan's quest line.
A wild hog. Kenta's pig must be protected from hordes of Grays to collect its pheromones. After capturing it in the wild at Korean Folk Town, the player can ride this Pig.

The second highest-level monster in all of Victoria Island, the Snack Bar being the first. Found in the deepest part of the Cursed Temple, at the Cursed Sanctuary. It attacks by dropping a meteor on you, scratching you, and tossing a fireball at you.
A clone of Mastema that must be killed to complete the 3rd job on a male Demon.
A monster used for training Dual Blades.
A water stealing fox-like creature found in Edelstein.
A stronger version of Evil Eye that must be killed for a quest in Ellinia.
A soldier found near Momijigaoka, Hayato and Kanna's starting area.
A monster found in the Southern outskirts of Pantheon.
Xenon's rival, who is trying to bring him back to Gelimer. You must defeat her while still in Edelstein.
Francis the Puppeteer, once again a punching bag, is involved in revamped Cygnus Knight quests.
A piece of iron that was brought to life with alchemy experiments. Found in the Alcadno Laboratory of Magatia.

A seed that has grown beyond its normal size through the powers of alchemy. It grew too big and is now trapped inside the flask. Makes a sound like breaking glass when hit, though the bottle remains intact. Found in the Zenumist Laboratory of Magatia.
A piece of reinforced iron that was brought to life with alchemy experiments. This one is larger and stronger. Found in the Alcadno Laboratory of Magatia.
An adorable toy rat that used to be harmless, but has begun attacking people. Found in the upper levels of inner Eos Tower of Ludibrium.
A darkened, faster version of Ratz. Found in the upper levels of inner Eos Tower of Ludibrium.

A spider that hangs from a web. It is immobile, making it very easy to avoid them. A pain to kill for melee classes, since they only move up and down. Its up and down movement rhythm also resets when hit, so a player has to time attacks to hit. Resistant to holy, and weak to fire and dark. Found in the upper levels of inner Eos Tower of Ludibrium.

A green version of Trixter. Easy to hit and dodge. slightly weaker weapon attack, slightly stronger magic attack, and slightly higher defenses. Resistant and weak to nothing, as the other counterpart has a resistance and a weakness. Found in the upper levels of inner Eos Tower of Ludibrium.

A seed that has grown beyond its normal size through the powers of alchemy. They grew too big and are now trapped inside the beakers. Three have teamed up to form a single, stronger monster. Found in the Zenumist Laboratory of Magatia.
A piece of Mithril, a legendary metal renowned for its strength, that was brought to life with alchemy. Found in the Alcadno Laboratory of Magatia.
A bird found in the upper levels of outer Eos Tower of Ludibrium. It used to be able to fly, but a patch removed this ability.
A bunny found in the upper-middle levels of outer Eos Tower of Ludibrium. It bangs its drum when it moves, and is similar to the Energizer Bunny.
A yellow toy helicopter found in the lower-middle levels of outer Eos Tower of Ludibrium. It used to be able to fly, but a patch removed this ability.
A purple toy plane that found in the lower-middle levels of outer Eos Tower of Ludibrium. It used to be able to fly, but a patch removed this ability.
A blue toy plane that resides near the lowest levels of outer Eos Tower of Ludibrium. It used to be able to fly, but a recent patch removed this ability.
A bird found in the lower levels of the Eos Tower of Ludibrium. They resemble Chirppy, and have the same stats. It used to be able to fly, but a patch removed this ability.
A young Homunculus, a person without a soul created through the powers of alchemy. Found deep in the Zenumist Laboratory of Magatia. It has the tendency to spawn in swarms.
A piece of reinforced Mithril that was brought to life with alchemy. This one is larger and stronger. Found in the Alcadno Laboratory of Magatia.
A large seal with a ranged attack of ice-based magic. Located directly to the west of Aquarium.
The first form of the Geist Balrog. Basically the same as a Jr. Balrog, but with higher HP.
This monster is part of the Le Tierre quest line in Edelstein's Verne Mine. It must be captured with a
A clone of Mastema that must be killed to complete the 3rd job on a female Demon.
Must be defeated for Evan's quest line.

The dark clone of Dances with Balrog. In order to advance as a Crusader, White Knight, or Dragon Knight, a warrior must challenge this monster when above level 60 and defeat it. Has a powerful attack that only works melee. Wields a glowing version of the level 80 one handed axe Gaea. While it's hard to avoid in battle since a Warrior needs to go close as well, if you need to heal or re-add enchantment, you can just run away from the clone and he won't be able to hurt you at any distance. He is also able to cast Blind and summons Tauromacis.

The dark clone of Grendel the Really Old. In order to advance as a Mage or Priest, a magician must challenge this monster when level 60 or above and defeat it. Uses 3rd Job Mage skills, such as Explosion. Slowest attacking clone and an easy fight for mages, since it cannot teleport, while they can (teleporting at the right moment negates Grendel's attacks). It can also seal and summons Tauromacis.

The dark clone of Athena Pierce. In order to advance as a Ranger or Sniper, a bowman must challenge this monster when level 60 or above and defeat it. She is wearing a brown Lineros (level 70 female overall) and wields the famed Dark Arund. The strafe fired by Athena is unusual in that it is only a single powerful arrow. Athena is also able to inflict weakness, which will interfere with jumpshots and evading Athena's attacks. She can also summons Tauromacis.

The dark clone of the Dark Lord. In order to advance as a Chief Bandit or Hermit, a thief must challenge this monster when level 60 or above and defeat it. Also uses 3rd Job skills, such as a Hermit's Avenger. Wears a Golden version of the level 60 thief hat Identity, and wields the Dark Scarab and a Dark Stud top and bottom. It can use weaken, which is a disadvantage to assassins, so stay out of it's affliction range. She can also summons Tauromacis.

The dark clone of Kyrin. In order to make the job advancement as an Infighter, a Pirate must challenge this monster when level 60 or above and defeat it. It uses many attack skills from both job divisions. Fights with another weaker clone, instead of summoning Tauromacis.
The dark clone of Kyrin. It fights alongside the stronger Kyrin.
Several of these have broken into Phantom's treasure vault in Ariant. They must be defeated to complete the 3rd job advancement as Phantom.
A Crow that steals things. Must be defeated twice in order to advance to 3rd Job as Aran: the first time when leaving Rien, and the second time when it steals a Yeti's jewel.
Must be destroyed to complete the 3rd job advancement on a Mechanic, Wild Hunter, or Battle Mage.
A toy octopus found in the lower-middle levels of inner Eos Tower of Ludibrium. Fairly fast and can jump, but otherwise not much of a threat.
An evolved Homun, a failed Homunculus created by the powers of Alchemy. Found deep in the Zenumist Laboratory of Magatia.
A robot that looks like a remote that grew legs and walked off, created with alchemy. Found in the Alcadno Laboratory of Magatia.

A strange robot with a roughly humanoid appearance, powered by the same stones that keep Orbis afloat and are used in alchemy experiments. It can fire a small missile out of its mouth. Found in the Alcadno Laboratory of Magatia.

A humanoid robot, connected to a giant chamber containing its mechanical heart. It has a poison mist attack. The strongest technological and monster found in the Alcadno Laboratory of Magatia. You are asked to retrieve its heart for a quest.

A phantom scientist who has seemingly lost his life while doing research, though he hasn't quite given up on his work yet. They can be found in a hidden map off of the Alcadno Laboratory, Area C-2. A ghost NPC named Parwen is also found here.
A specter dog found near the Reclamation HQ and with their masters, Specter Tamers.
Must be killed for several Heliseum quests.
A dragon-like monster with leaves on its back, found in Heliseum's Twisted Forest.

An advanced form of the Rumo and Triple Rumo, found in Magatia's Zenumist Laboratory. It can heal itself and nearby allies by 10,000. It can also cast Avoid Armor, which makes all non-critical attacks miss for a certain amount of time. To attack you, it can charge energy and release it.

The corrupted version of Rurumo, which must be killed for the Silent Crusade. It is a Rurumo with the potions switched spots, and with a dark aura. The closed-eye potion is pink instead of blue, the opened-eye potion is purple instead of red. It has the same abilities as the real Rurumo.

One of the three Showa Town bosses. The Male Boss is found at the highest floor of the hideout and Showa Town three. When attacked, he takes out his gun and starts shooting, or starts to physically fight you. At the same time, he can summon the Extras and Leaders to help out.

The third phase of the boss of Amoria PQ. Once its Crimson Balrog form is defeated, it will turn into what you see here. Except, Geist Balrog can cast Weapon or Magic Cancel. It can also Dispel. The most annoying ability it has is its Teleport, which warps to random spots at any given time. Geist can be translated to mean ghost in German, and though this Balrog is somewhat transparent, it is strangely not undead.

A more powerful Bloctopus. It attacks by spitting out a small projectile with a long range, but moves slowly. Otherwise, it acts the same as any other Bloctopus. Found in the lower-middle levels of inner Eos Tower of Ludibrium.
A huge Golem made out of the same bricks used to build Ludibrium. It is tremendously slow. Found in inner Eos Tower's lower floors.
A dragon-like monster with leaves on its back, found in Heliseum's Twisted Forest.
A specter wielding a shield that can be found near the Reclamation HQ and the Black Market.
Must be killed for several Heliseum quests.
A dinosaur-like monster found in Heliseum's forest.
A huge golem made of the same toy bricks used to build Ludibrium. Stronger and faster than the Block Golem. Found in inner Eos Tower's lower floors.

A huge, monstrous Homunculus, a failed attempt at creating a person with the powers of Alchemy. A wretched monster rarely found in the deepest parts of Magatia's Zenumist Laboratory with the Homunculi. One of its attacks can drain your MP by 400. The other attack cannot.
A dinosaur-like monster found in Heliseum's forest.
A specter carrying ores, found in the Nameless Forest and near the Black Market.
Must be killed for several Heliseum quests.
A surveillance camera found in the Alcadno Laboratory of Magatia, with the Roids.

The corrupted version of Homunscullo, which must be killed for the Silent Crusade. The bat-like creature is purple instead of reddish pink, with a bulb-shaped hat. It has the same abilities as the real Homunscullo.
A flying Red Wyvern summoned by Horntail.
A flying Red Wyvern summoned by Chaos Horntail.

A huge, prehistoric snail. It resembles a younger form of Mano. Its shell is hard as rock, and algae and moss grow on it freely. Found in Ellin Forest, an area in the past. It attacks by screeching at you.
A huge, prehistoric stump-like monster. Looking into the eyes gives it the feeling of a Wraith. Found in Ellin Forest, an area in the past. It attacks with bats flying out of its hole.

A huge prehistoric mushroom. It looks like it may be related to the Horned and Green Mushroom family, rather than the Orange mushrooms. Found in Ellin Forest, an area in the past. It attacks by stomping the ground.

A rocky, centipede-like monster. Found in Ellin Forest, an area in the past. Unlike all the other monsters in Ellin Forest, it doesn't appear to be an early version of anything. It attacks by smashing the ground with the front of its body.
A dragon-like monster with leaves on its back, found in Heliseum's Forbidden Forest.

A huge Golem made out of the same bricks used to build Ludibrium, with a Bloctopus riding it. Its shockwaves are nothing to sneeze at. Found in a Hidden Tower off the 4th floor of the Eos Tower. Despite being the most powerful monster in the Eos Tower, it neither moves fast nor has the ability to jump, though it is usually surrounded by regular and King Block Golems.
A robot found in Magatia's Alcadno Laboratory. It uses a close range laser, electricity, and rockets to attack. Must be defeated for the Silent Crusade.
An enormous, prehistoric wild boar. Found in Ellin Forest, an area in the past. It attacks by shoving rocks at you with its tusks.
A slightly stronger version of Primitive Boar, with slightly higher defense rate. Found inside the Rocky Mountain Cave.
A dinosaur-like monster found in Heliseum's forest.

A boss found in the passage between the Zenumist and Alcadno Laboratories of Magatia. To access it, you need to obtain a password from Parwen after doing a series of quests. It knows Cancel Weapon Attack, Magic Attack Up, and Magic Defense Up. If it starts opening its mouth, watch out for the missile that it launches. Once defeated, the jaw falls off, the left eye pops out and the leaf on its head disappears.

The corrupted version of Chimera, which must be killed for the Silent Crusade. The leaf is bigger and more sharp, and more leaves are on the big leaf, and wears a purple outfit instead of the green outfit, and the body is more darker. It has the same abilities as the real Chimera.
A fairy monster found in Ellin Forest. It can poison and attack with its wings.
Another fairy monster found in Ellin Forest. It possesses the same abilities as its counterpart above.
A yellow slime found in the Krakian Jungle of Masteria, right outside of New Leaf City. They are fast. Unlike several of the weaker Slimes, these do not have a common drop.

A specter dog tamer that is always found with Specter Battle Hounds, thus lacking a pure spawn map, which can make quests involving these monsters time-consuming. Found in the Nameless Forest and near the Black Market.
Must be killed for several Heliseum quests.
An obstacle created by the Green Hobi. It's relatively easy to defeat.

A boss Primitive Boar found in Ellin Forest. It is able to jump and pound the ground, causing rocks to fall from the ceiling. It can also shove rocks onto you with its tusks. It can also summon Violent Primitive Boars when it feels threatened.

A monster riding a pirated ship around Ossyria invading other ships. It may resemble that of Jr. Balrog, which can be found at the deepest part of the Dungeon at the center of Victoria Island, but the difference being that it has wings to fly with. The general attacking ability, especially the magic attack, is off the charts. Since it is evil by heart, religious powers work well against it, so try attacking it with holy spells.
The second form of Geist Balrog. Basically the same as Crimson Balrog, but has more HP.
A Green Cornian summoned by Horntail's Wings.
A Green Cornian summoned by Chaos Horntail's Wings.
A weaker version of Manon. Must be killed to complete the 4th job advancement on an adventurer.
A weaker version of Griffey. Must be killed to complete the 4th job advancement on an adventurer.
A boss related to Aran. An Aran has to defeat his uncontrollable spirit to complete the 4th job advancement.
Must be killed to complete the 4th job advancement on a Mechanic, Wild Hunter, or Battle Mage. It can cast Damage Reflect and summon AF Androids.
Must be killed to complete the 4th job advancement on a female Demon Slayer. This form can use 3rd job skills.
Must be killed to complete the 4th job advancement on a male Demon Slayer. This form can use 3rd job skills.
Must be killed to complete the 4th job advancement on a female Demon Slayer. This form can use 4th job skills.
Must be killed to complete the 4th job advancement on a male Demon Slayer. This form can use 4th job skills.
Appears in the Hallowed Ground of Blaze. It drops the Blaze Stone which is needed to make a Dream Key to enter Cygnus's Garden.
A samurai found in Zipangu's Ninja Castle. It wields a spear that it jabs at you.
A mid ranked ninja found in Zipangu's Ninja Castle. It can spit poison out of its dart.
A corrupted Thunder Breaker. Found at Knight District 2. It can use Somersault Kick and Flash Fist which hits 2 times so be careful when hunting these.
Appears in the Hallowed Ground of Wind. It drops the Wind Stone which is needed to make a Dream Key to enter Cygnus's Garden.
A female ninja found in Zipangu's Ninja Castle. Wields two knives which she uses to assault you when engaged in battle.
A high ranked ninja found in Zipangu's Ninja Castle. Wields an enormous shuriken and fights like an assassin.
A corrupted Wind Archer. Found at Knight District 3. It can use Storm Break and Double Shot, which hits 2 times, so be careful when hunting these.
Appears in the Hallowed Ground of Night. It drops the Night Stone which is needed to make a Dream Key to enter Cygnus's Garden.
The highest ranked ninja found in Zipangu's Ninja Castle. He has two flame-based attacks: a close range and a long range attack.
Appears during the boss battle with Madman Mori Ranmaru. It can heal itself and any monster nearby for 90 million health every 7 seconds.
Appears during the boss battle with Madman Mori Ranmaru. It can stun players for 5 seconds, every 17 seconds.
Appears during the boss battle with Madman Mori Ranmaru. It can summon Fire, which can kill anyone that comes in contact with it.
The Boss
Must be killed at the Secret Garden in order to talk to Neinheart of the future.
A corrupted Dawn Warrior. Appears at Knight District 4. It can use Brandish, and raise its weapon attack by 20% by using Rage.
Appears in the Hallowed Ground of Thunder. It drops the Thunder Stone which is needed to make a Dream Key to enter Cygnus's Garden.
A corrupted Night Walker. Appears at Knights' Chamber 1 and Hall of Honor. It can use Vampire and Avenger which hits 6 times with fairly low damage.

A powerful samurai found in Zipangu's Ninja Castle. Fights with powerful sword sweeps and an electrical attack. It is actually just a suit of armor controlled by two little demon-like people. It moves at the speed of a Blue/Red Snail, but it can jump. This boss is also one of the few weak to heal.
A corrupted Blaze Wizard. Appears at Knights' Chamber 2 and Hall of Honor. It can summon Ifrit and use Flame Gear which can cause a slow debuff on your character.
Summoned by Advanced Knight B. Same as the old Ifrit.
A corrupted Thunder Breaker. Appears at Knights' Chamber 3 and Hall of Honor. It can use Sharkwave and Corkscrew Blow which hits 2 times so be careful when hunting these.
A monster found at the entrances to the Chaos versions of Von Bon, Pierre, and the Crimson Queen.
Found in the Neglected Garden of Root Abyss, a map unlocked after you defeat all the bosses in Root Abyss.

The first form of the false Daimyo, found in Zipangu's Ninja Castle. When defeated, it transforms into the toad. He has two attacks, a physical based ranged attack where a ninja pops in front of him with a table of candy, which he flips and causes candy to drop on you, and a magic based range attack where he summons Ninja Archers which execute a full screen Lightning-based Arrow Rain skill.

The second form of the false Daimyo, now in its true form. He has new attacks which do about the same damage as the first form and the defense is now beefed up to about The Boss's defense. Summons Kaede Toads to fight alongside it.

This arm is found on the top left during the battle with Chaos Zakum. Like all the other arms, it can fly to a spot on the ground, indicated by a flashing signal, and capable of killing the player in one hit. During the platform phase, it can clap with Arm 5, firing out a laser (indicated by the ground flashing on the adjacent platforms) that also kills the player in one hit. When defeated, it respawns after a while, unless all the other arms are taken out before this occurs.

This arm is second from the top left during the battle with Chaos Zakum. Like all the other arms, it can fly to a spot on the ground, indicated by a flashing signal, and capable of killing the player in one hit. During the platform phase, it can clap with Arm 6, firing out a laser (indicated by the ground flashing on the adjacent platforms) that also kills the player in one hit. When defeated, it respawns after a while, unless all the other arms are taken out before this occurs.

This arm is third from the top left during the battle with Chaos Zakum. Like all the other arms, it can fly to a spot on the ground, indicated by a flashing signal, and capable of killing the player in one hit. During the platform phase, it can clap with Arm 7, firing out a laser (indicated by the ground flashing on the adjacent platforms) that also kills the player in one hit. When defeated, it respawns after a while, unless all the other arms are taken out before this occurs.

This arm is found on the bottom left during the battle with Chaos Zakum. Like all the other arms, it can fly to a spot on the ground, indicated by a flashing signal, and capable of killing the player in one hit. During the platform phase, it remains inactive, along with Arm 8, while the other arms fight back. When defeated, it respawns after a while, unless all the other arms are taken out before this occurs.

This arm is found on the top right during the battle with Chaos Zakum. Like all the other arms, it can fly to a spot on the ground, indicated by a flashing signal, and capable of killing the player in one hit. During the platform phase, it can clap with Arm 1, firing out a laser (indicated by the ground flashing on the adjacent platforms) that also kills the player in one hit. When defeated, it respawns after a while, unless all the other arms are taken out before this occurs.

This arm is second from the top right during the battle with Chaos Zakum. Like all the other arms, it can fly to a spot on the ground, indicated by a flashing signal, and capable of killing the player in one hit. During the platform phase, it can clap with Arm 2, firing out a laser (indicated by the ground flashing on the adjacent platforms) that also kills the player in one hit. When defeated, it respawns after a while, unless all the other arms are taken out before this occurs.

This arm is third from the top right during the battle with Chaos Zakum. Like all the other arms, it can fly to a spot on the ground, indicated by a flashing signal, and capable of killing the player in one hit. During the platform phase, it can clap with Arm 3, firing out a laser (indicated by the ground flashing on the adjacent platforms) that also kills the player in one hit. When defeated, it respawns after a while, unless all the other arms are taken out before this occurs.

This arm is found on the bottom right during the battle with Chaos Zakum. Like all the other arms, it can fly to a spot on the ground, indicated by a flashing signal, and capable of killing the player in one hit. During the platform phase, it remains inactive, along with Arm 8, while the other arms fight back. When defeated, it respawns after a while, unless all the other arms are taken out before this occurs.

The main body of Chaos Zakum. It is key to attack the body, as attacking the arms will not directly damage the body. However, it will make certain phases easier. While the arms are alive, the body will not directly attack, unless all the arms have been defeated quickly enough. In this case, Zakum will be able to charge up an attack, remaining stagnant for a few seconds, and unleash an explosion that does 99% of your health as damage. Zakum will also be able to summon 2 of each minion during this phase, as well as cast Weapon Cancel. In the last phase of the battle, during the last 20% of Zakum's health, Zakum will gain new abilities. It will be able to burrow into the ground and reappear on top of you, as well as cast Magic Cancel, and cause rocks to fall from the ceiling, which can slow you down and prevent you from using special movement skills, such as Flash Jump. Its main attack during this phase involves a green cube appearing, and the players must hide under the cube to avoid getting instantly killed by its main attack, where it leaps into the air and slams into the ground.

This is a statue found at the top of Temple of Time. It fights along side Pink Bean in Phases 1-4, where it has 60% Defense Rate. In Phase 5, it reappears, but is slightly stronger, and has 25% Defense Rate. It has three attacks: lightning with seal, 1/1 with stun, and a physical attack with slow. Its 1/1-stun attack requires either an autopotter or VERY quick hands to survive.

This is a statue found at the top of Temple of Time. It fights along side Pink Bean in Phases 2-4, where it has 60% Defense Rate. In Phase 5, it reappears, but is slightly stronger, and has 25% PDR/MDR. In Phase 5, it reappears, but is slightly stronger, and has 25% Defense Rate. It has three attacks: lightning with darkness, 1/1 with Zombify, and a physical attack with poison. It can use Reverse Key and Dispel.

This is a statue found at the top of Temple of Time. The symbol on its chest reveals it to be fire based, making it strong to fire, but with a weakness to Ice. It fights along side Pink Bean in Phases 3-4, where it has 60% Defense Rate. In Phase 5, it reappears, but is slightly stronger, and has 25% Defense Rate. It has two attacks: fire with slow, and physical with stun (markers). It can also use Seal, Weakness, Magic Reflect, Physical Reflect, and All Damage Reflect.

This is a statue found at the top of Temple of Time. The symbol on its chest reveals it to be Ice based, making it strong to ice, but with a weakness to Fire. It fights along side Pink Bean when activated in Phase 4, where it has 60% Defense Rate. In Phase 5, it reappears, but is slightly stronger, and has 25% Defense Rate. It has two attacks: ice with darkness, and physical with crazy skull. It has three skills: Weaken, Banish, and Seduce (left, jump left, jump right).

This is a statue found at the top of Temple of Time, perched precariously over a mirror in front of which the Pink Bean sits. Based on the Goddess herself, it's the strongest of the statues. It can regenerate HP and MP, Dispel, use Weapon and Magic Cancel, cast poison fog, and can use the debuff 'Zombify', which causes the heal skill to deal damage instead of healing. As one might expect from the statue of the Goddess, it's immune to Holy, and strong to Fire, Ice, Dark, and Lightning, making Poison the only possible element that can harm it. It fights along side Pink Bean when activated in form 5 of the battle.

The boss of the Temple of Time. Pink Bean is a being from another world who was accidentally summoned through the Goddess' mirror by an unidentified man known as Kirstun, who was actually trying to bring back the Black Mage. Don't let its awfully adorable appearance fool you, it can be a tough boss to fight. It can summon Mini Beans, and sports a resistance to Physical, Holy, Fire, Dark, and Ice. This boss has 4 different attacks. The first attack is similar to a Bishop's Genesis, except that the skill fires holy rays upwards and stuns the target. The second attack is a mid ranged big bang like attack that knocks you back a good distance. This boss can also summon a megaphone in which treble clef notes will rain down upon Maplers indicated by a small quaver note on the ground which Seduces. Finally, it can also thump his tail on the ground sending miniature forms of himself leaping up in the air which is a 1/1+seal attack. Can also use Damage Reflect when its HP reaches 90% or below, and also inherits the Zombify skill which causes your party to be hurt instead of healed if healed by a bishop, as well as reduces the effect of healing potions by half. On defeat, Pink Bean cries before hopping through a very dark portal, glaring at the players before it leaves.
Found in Mu Lung while doing Chapter 2 of the Grand Athenaeum, Empress In Training. The same as a real Reindeer.
A cute cuddly teddy bear that has come to life. Found in Ludibrium's Cloud and Sky Terrace area. Can move and jump on platforms.
A pink version of Brown Teddy. Found in Ludibrium's Cloud and Sky Terrace area. Can move and jump up on platforms.
An upgraded Teddy that also appears within Ludibrium's Cloud and Sky Terrace area. Can move and jump on platforms.
A Wraith found in the Phantom Forest. Much stronger than the one in Kerning City's subways.

A bright red tree, similar to Phantom Tree, but grows much closer to the Mountain. Found deep in the far reaches of Phantom Forest in Masteria. When approached, it makes a sound before using its attack which causes a red root to grow onto the player.

A bright red tree, similar to Phantom Tree, but grows much closer to the Mountain. Found deep in the far reaches of Phantom Forest in Masteria. When approached, it makes a sound before using its attack which causes a red root to grow onto the player.
Found in Mu Lung while doing Chapter 2 of the Grand Athenaeum, Empress In Training. The same as a real Bellflower Root.
A mother duck on wheels with 3 ducklings on wheels following it. Fast, but it cannot jump. Resides with members of the teddy family, in Ludibrium's Cloud and Sky Terrace area.
A toy knight on a wooden horse. Fast and incredibly durable, with the ability to increase their physical attack and defense. Found in Ludibrium's Cloud and Sky Terrace area.
A blue robot that patrols the Toy Factory of Ludibrium. It resists both ice and fire, and is very slow. A very large amount of them can be found in the Apparatus Room.

The Elderwraiths are spirits of Crimsonwood Keep heroes who fell in battle but were never buried. According to legend, a hermit who threw Ilbi at an Elderwraith found them transformed into Crystal Ilbi upon retrieving them. This does not occur for players in game, however.
Found in Mu Lung while doing Chapter 2 of the Grand Athenaeum, Empress In Training. The same as a real Peach Monkey.
The boss of Harps, located in a Mystic Gate at Sky Nest II. It can cast magic from its mouth, and cause feathers to rain from the sky hitting you 3 times.
A red version of a Robo. It is faster than ordinary Robos and deals more damage, but is otherwise still an easy monster to overcome. Spawns in the Toy Factory.

A larger version of the Tick. This monster is much better suited to combat than its smaller lookalike. Strangely enough its size is programmed to be the same as a Tick, so it is easy to snipe. Found in Ludibrium's Clock Tower area.
A specter found in Heliseum's Nameless Forest and near the Downtown Black Market. Attacks by swinging its sword at you three times.

A Dark Pepe riding a Dark Yeti. Found at Sharp Cliff 4 of the El Nath Dungeon. Like the normal Yeti & Pepe, Dark Yeti & Pepe separate after being knocked out as one. Since they are filled with darkness, holy attacks will do well against them.
A bipedal crocodile found in Lion King's Castle. Attacks by swinging its sword to create a shockwave.
The lowest rank of Chronos. Unlike most other undead monsters, they have no weakness against holy magic. Has no magic attack. Found in Ludibrium's Clock Tower area.
The middle rank of Chronos, which gains a magic-based attack that it uses on intruders. Again, weak to healing powers but not to holy magic. Found in Ludibrium's Clock Tower area.

The highest rank of Chronos. Like its counterparts, it's vulnerable to heal but not weak against holy magic. They are similar to Platoon Chronos. An easy way to tell them apart from Platoon Chronos is by the color of their hat; Master Chronos have purple hats. Has a magic attack that hits much higher than their counterparts. Found in Ludibrium's Clock Tower area.

A yellow jester. Found on the left side path at Ludibrium's Clock Tower Bottom Floor, the Warped Path of Time, with its purple counterpart, in a map which requires 25 Star Force to deal full damage. Doesn't jump or move fast, but has an unavoidable magic attack and generally un-noteworthy drops.

A lost soul that has inhabited a discarded teddy bear. The soul can be seen guiding the bear, hovering over its shoulder. Found on the right side path Ludibrium's Clock Tower Bottom Floor, the Forgotten Path of Time, with its larger counterpart, in a map which requires 25 Star Force to deal full damage. Only the teddy's body, not the soul, can cause contact damage, and take damage. It has a ranged attack that looks a lot like Magic Claw.

The corrupted counterpart of the legendary Windreavers, a group of ranged fighters who once served as soldiers at Crimsonwood Keep. Fires am energy orbs using the odd one-handed crossbow it carries, resulting in a charged up throwing star hitting its target. Spawns in the caves of Crimsonwood Mountain and at the Crimsonwood Keep of Masteria.

The corrupted counterpart of the brave Stormcaster Knights, who once operated out of Crimsonwood Keep. Lukan de Vrisien, a true Stormcaster, has a vendetta against these enemies. The magic attacks that appear when it swings its spear are pretty dangerous, so definitely don't underestimate them!
The strongest specter found in the Tyrant's Castle. It can reduce your speed to 80, and swing its scythe at you.
Must be killed for several Heliseum quests.
A red Crocky that must be killed to break the first seal in Lion King's Castle.
A blue bipedal wolf found at the entrance to Normal Hilla. Attacks by swinging at you with its axe, and by charging and releasing a shock of energy which has a long range.
A red bipedal wolf found at the entrance to Normal Hilla. Uses the same attacks as its weaker blue counterpart.

A monster summoned by Normal Hilla. It does no damage, but it has the ability to pull you toward it, making you unable to move out of its range, until you defeat it. Deadly when Hilla uses her laser blast attack.

A clock-like owl found in Ludbrium's Clock Tower area with the Master Chronos. Timer's attack can knock you back a fair distance. When Timer does launch an attack, it's easy to tell as its head spins around, revealing the opposite side, which is gray. It also has the ability to cast Weapon and Magic Cancel.

One of the bosses in Leafre, found in Manon's Forest in the Kentaurus Areas. Necessary to be defeated to get an item to enter the Cave of Life. It can breathe fire at close range, which reduces your HP and MP to 1. The egg can also attack you, which can stun.
The corrupted version of Manon, which must be killed for the Silent Crusade. It has the same abilities as the real Manon.
The corrupted version of Griffey, which must be killed for the Silent Crusade. It has the same abilities as the real Griffey.
Eleanor the Black Witch must be defeated at the end of Chapter 3 of the Grand Athenaeum, The Black Witch. She is the one responsible for cursing Ereve and turning everyone except Shinsoo into stone.
Must be killed for several Heliseum quests.
A purple Mushroom of the jumping variety that lives on the outskirts of New Leaf City. Found in the Krakian Jungle of Masteria.
A bee monster. Its appearance is based off of a cash shop effect. Found in Bigger Ben's MesoGears area near New Leaf City.
A flying Blue Wyvern summoned by Horntail.
A flying Blue Wyvern summoned by Chaos Horntail.

An elephant with fiery abilities. Its main attack is to breathe fire from its trunk. Its high tech appearance might hint a relation to the lost city of Krakia. Found in Bigger Ben's MesoGears area near New Leaf City.
A specter found near Heliseum's Downtown Black Market. It attacks by swinging its club at you.
Must be killed for several Heliseum quests.

The beautiful queen of the fairies. She is the final boss of the Ellin Forest quest line. She possesses various skills, such as seduce which causes your character to lose control and go right for few seconds, teleport to a random point of the map, a annoying tornado which spins your character in the air for few seconds dealing 200 damage per second, poison which puts a debuff that causes you to lose HP overtime, and creates lightning to shock the player from far distance.
