When defeated, it may drop Ephenia's Ring.
A strange beetle monster. It can slow you, and has a short ranged attack similar to Hectors in El Nath. Found east of Leafre.
A furry creature found west of Leafre. It can spit a projectile at you, and occasionally weaken you, preventing you from jumping.

An elephant monster with electric based attacks. Its high tech appearance may imply a relationship with the lost city of Krakia. Spawns in both in the Krakian Jungle and the MesoGears of Bigger Ben in New Leaf City.

A legendary bird-like monster found in the Krakian Jungle of New Leaf City. In the latest iTCG update, Gryphons drop the rare Jungle Lily, used to upgrade the jungle weapons into their Suma and Magna forms.
A powerful mechanical spider monster that roams the deepest parts of Bigger Ben in New Leaf City. These ran Jack Masque out of Amoria, causing him to have a vendetta towards them.
A specter found near Heliseum's Downtown Black Market. It can't attack, but it turns angry and charges at you when you come in range.
Must be killed for several Heliseum quests.
A flying Dark Wyvern summoned by Horntail. It can dispel with its wind gust attack, and it can heal nearby allies by 300,000.
A flying Dark Wyvern summoned by Chaos Horntail. It can dispel with its wind gust attack, and it can heal nearby allies by 3,000,000.
The Beetle's exoskeleton is now made of steel, making it stronger. It uses weaken, making it annoying for people to kill. But other than that it's just an ordinary Beetle. Found east of Leafre.
A dark counterpart to Rash found west of Leafre. It can spit a projectile at you, and occasionally curse you, cutting the EXP you'll gain in half.
A black dragon found in Leafre's Dragon Nest. It attacks by creating a gust of wind to hit you, and by creating beams that come out from the ground.
Appears once it is separated from the Dark Pepe.
Appears once it is separated from the Dark Yeti.
Found in Fantasy Theme World's Funny Station 1. Based on Scaredy Scarlion from Malaysia.
Found in Fantasy Theme World's Funny Station 2 and the Ghost Mansion. Based on Ratatula from Malaysia
Found in Fantasy Theme World's Ghost Mansion.
A huge white monkey that's very angry. This has an earthquake attack. The tiny monkey also can feed it a watermelon, and it spits out the seeds at you. Found in the jungles outside of Golden Temple.
These beasts have a skill to boost their weapon defense. They also possess a fierce clawing attack, so be careful. Located deep in the cliffs right of El Nath.
An annoying flying eye that is found after the Dead Mine of El Nath.
A bear riding on the back of a wolf. Found in Lion King's Castle. Attacks by smashing its mace into the ground.

A medium speed monster. If you're in the map, Thanatos automatically attacks. Beware, it can inflict various status ailments including poison. The right side guardian to Papulatus' layer at the base of the Clock Tower, in a map which requires 28 Star Force to deal full damage.
Found in Fantasy Theme World's Extreme Station 1. Based on Jester Scarlion from Malaysia.
Found in Fantasy Theme World's Extreme Station 2. Based on Froscola from Malaysia.

The offspring of a Human and the Spirit of snow. It has the appearance of a yeti because of that cross but a heart of a human. It was neglected from society and fled to the El Nath mountains, which were created just for it. Usually hidden from everyone, it's been attacking people because the statue of its mother has been destroyed by someone and will attack when it sees someone. Beware, it has an icy mist attack that deals 500 damage every few seconds, which can be deadly to lower levels or melee characters. Another problem is that Snowman has the ability to stun you so you may end up getting stunned within the mist. It also has a projectile, long-ranged snowball attack which is shot from the yeti's mouth. When in danger, Jr. Yetis are called to help, which is indicated by the Hector throwing a snowball onto the ground. Found in El Nath: Sharp Cliff 3.
The leader of white monkeys in Golden Temple. Must be defeated to obtain Ritaya's Camera.

A stronger Werewolf, able to summon its lower brethren, and sporting a resistance to ice-based attacks at the expense of a fire-based weakness. However, as a Werewolf has high weapon defense, a Lycanthrope has high magic defense. A powerful Fire Arch Mage can handle one without much trouble. Make sure to avoid its claw attack though; use the same methods to avoid it as you would on a Werewolf! Located deep in El Nath, just before the Zombie maps.
Found in Fantasy Theme World's Extreme Station 3. Based on Booper Scarlion from Malaysia.
Found in Fantasy Theme World's Fantasy Station 1 and the entrance to the Animal Show. Based on Yabber Doo from Malaysia.
Found in Fantasy Theme World's Fantasy Station 2 and the entrance to the Animal Show. Based on Vikerola from Malaysia.
A statue that has come to life. Attacks by swinging its sword at you. Found in Golden Temple's Goblin Caves. Its appearance is based on that of a Demon from the Thailand National epic, the Ramakien.
A corrupted Wyvern found in Leafre's past.

A purple jester. Like its yellow counterpart, it will attack you with unavoidable magic. Found on the left side path at Ludibrium's Clock Tower Bottom Floor, the Warped Path of Time, in a map which requires 25 Star Force to deal full damage.

Another teddy bear that has been inhabited by a much larger soul. Appears with regular Soul Teddies. Like Soul Teddies, it cannot jump or fall over. Also, like the regular soul teddies, only the teddy, not the soul part, can cause contact damage. Found on the right side path of Ludibrium's Clock Tower Bottom Floor, the Forgotten Path of Time, in a map which requires 25 Star Force to deal full damage.

A fat jester that spawns on the left side path of Ludibrium's Clock Tower Bottom Floor, the Warped Path of Time, in a map which requires 25 Star Force to deal full damage. It can slam its grandfather clock into the ground, hurting you.

A monster that resembles a dark grandfather clock. It attacks you with an unavoidable magic attack. Found on the right side path of Ludibrium's Clock Tower Bottom Floor, the Forgotten Path of Time, with its darker counterpart, in a map which requires 25 Star Force to deal full damage
A small Yeti found at the beginning of El Nath's Dungeon. Transforms into a Yeti when it dies.

The Jr. Yeti's larger form. This version spawns normally. It retains its fire weakness and add an earthquake attack (think King Slime/Mushmom) to its repertoire. This version can also boost its weapon attack/defense.
The Jr. Yeti's larger form. This version spawns when the Transforming Jr. Yeti dies. It retains its fire weakness and add an earthquake attack (think King Slime/Mushmom) to its repertoire.

A redder and more powerful counterpart of Buffoon, with a more potent attack. Spawns with Buffoons in the same map on the left side path of Ludibrium's Clock Tower Bottom Floor, the Warped Path of Time, in a map which requires 25 Star Force to deal full damage.

A darker counterpart of Klock with a more potent magic attack. Spawns with Klocks in the same map on the right side path of Ludibrium's Clock Tower Bottom Floor, the Forgotten Path of Time, in a map which requires 25 Star Force to deal full damage.

A corrupted version of the Flamekeeper from Crimsonwood Keep, a fiery magician who roams the caves in Crimsonwood Mountain and the Crimsonwood Keep. She might look human, but once defeated, she transforms into a fireball that looks a lot like Headless Horseman's head. Be careful, as she shoots a fire bow which hits you with fire magic.

A fireball that looks a lot like Headless Horseman's head. It breathes fire for its main attack, and flies around freely, similar to how Sophilia Dolls work. Found in Crimsonwood Mountain's caves and the Keep.

The corrupted counterpart to the Shadowknights, one of the 4 guilds of Ancient Crimsonwood. They use stealth tactics to attack any and all passersby. They spawn throughout the Mountainside, the Keep, and in a few of the caverns. It can be quite dangerous, however some of the others will do more damage with certain attacks. Has a great undiluted spawn inside the Keep, at the Wrath of Night guild hall.
Must be killed to break the second seal in Lion King's Castle. Also summoned by Prison Guard Ani.
Must be killed to break the third seal in Lion King's Castle. Also summoned by Prison Guard Ani.
A white reindeer found in Lion King's Castle. Attacks by hitting you with its spear 3 times.

A blue pirate ship. Being a ghost, it is surprisingly not affected by heal. Attacks by shooting its cannon, which is unavoidable, but it will only shoot you if you are in an elevated position or at some distance away. Found on the left side path of Ludibrium's Clock Tower Bottom Floor, the Warped Path of Time, in a map which requires 26 Star Force to deal full damage.

As you further progress into the Forgotten Path of Time, the souls that have possessed the raggedy teddy bears get fiercer and uglier than the first soul teddy. Shoots a magic projectile that moves very fast. Found on the right side path of Ludibrium's Clock Tower Bottom Floor, the Forgotten Path of Time, in a map which requires 26 Star Force to deal full damage.

A legendary elemental of air that has yet to hatch. It's aggressive, but it cannot inflict touch damage. Attacks by bursting from the shell and tossing the fragments at you. Once in a while they spawn at Path of Peril alongside fully grown Typhons. Originally, when a Baby Typhon was defeated, it dropped Dark Scrolls and Tobi throwing stars at a very high rate. Now it drops nothing, making it a rather pointless monster. Found at the Crimsonwood Mountain of Masteria.

A monster found west of Leafre, relatively weak. Looks similar to an NPC in the 3rd Job Instructor's home, named Shammos. Humans who use too much dark magic are doomed to turn into Hobi eventually, and that's what happened to Shammos.

This is a robot that was created by Professor Foxwit. After performing its first task, it went haywire and ran off with a map of the MesoGears. It now roams the Krakian Jungle outside of New Leaf City, attacking by shocking you with its wires.

This is an animated bomb monster found in the Krakian Jungle of New Leaf City. They cause a lot of trouble for the city's residents by blowing up construction equipment. Originally, these monsters would infinitely duplicate if hit but not killed, but this was nerfed quickly due to abuse. Thieves can purchase a throwing star from the Cash Shop which resembles a Boomer.

A Nependeath-like flower that grows in Krakian Jungle and MesoGears. It can't move, but it can fire its tongue out of the mouth-like petals. This magic attack is unavoidable and quick. Low level adventurers may want to be careful when around these, as these monsters attack without warning. In the set 3 iTCG update, Mighty Maple Eaters began to drop the rare Jungle Lilies, which are used in the ritual to upgrade Taru weapons. Gryphons are a better hunting option, however, as their pure, high rate spawn raises the odds of finding one.
A specter found in the Tyrant's Castle of Heliseum. It attacks by shoving its sword arm into you.
Must be killed for several Heliseum quests.

Another monster found near Leafre. This version of the Hobi can summon Thorny Vines when provoked. Looks similar to Shammos, the NPC in charge of the Hoblin King PQ. Humans who use too much dark magic are doomed to turn into Hobis eventually, and that's what happened to Shammos.
A furry human-like creature found near Leafre. Its magic attack can cause stun, so they might not be a good monster to train on if you can't kill them quickly.
These have invaded NLC recently, leading to the destruction of it. It attacks by launching its arm at you. Even after the restoration of NLC, these are still lingering around the Krakian Jungle.

These have invaded NLC recently, leading to the destruction of it. It attacks by launching its arm at you. Another version is in the Escape Route, and launches an arm shaped like a drill. Even after the restoration of NLC, these are still lingering around the Krakian Jungle.
A specter found in the Tyrant's Castle of Heliseum. It can weaken you, making you unable to jump. It can also toss a magic spell at you.
Must be killed for several Heliseum quests.
A robber found in Ellin Forest while doing Chapter 1 of the Grand Athenaeum, The White Mage. He can hit you with his pickaxe.
Found in Aqua Road while doing Chapter 2 of the Grand Athenaeum, Empress In Training. The same as a real Sparker.
A Dark Cornian summoned by Horntail's Wings.
A Dark Cornian summoned by Chaos Horntail's Wings.

An immobile rock house. Don't mistake it for a part of the background. When threatened, the Gobies inside can attack with a long-ranged spell. The Gobies can also cast a protective Weapon Cancel barrier on the house, rendering Physical attacks useless. When the house takes enough damage, it explodes and summons 6 angry Gobies. Found in west and east Aqua Dungeon.
Emerges after their house is destroyed.
Found in the Shadow Veil Forest's Labyrinth. Swings its daggers at you at close range. Much stronger than the ones in Masteria.

A car with no wheels. Both the name and the monster itself are themed after two different TV shows, The Flintstones (Yabba Dabba Doo!, Fred's catchphrase) and Scooby Doo. The van appears to be modeled after Scooby's Mystery Machine, but is moved by walking on foot, similar to the cars in Flintstones. It flashes its headlights as an attack, with super knock back. You can see a stuffed Scarlion and Ratatula on the top. Found in Malaysia's Fantasy Theme Park.
A white sheep found along Shanghai's Rural Area, near Yu Garden.
A black sheep found along Shanghai's Rural Area, near Yu Garden. Its eyes glow red when it attacks, damaging you.
A ghost holding a neon sign found along Shanghai's Nanjing Road, near Yu Garden. The sign glows when it attacks, damaging you.
A stronger lizard-like monster found in Leafre's Dragon Forest. It has the same attacks as its green counterpart.
A monster from Temple of Time, found in Memory Lane 1. It casts a magic attack by concentrating magic into a sphere, then releasing it.

A living, moving tree found in the Shadow Veil Forest's Labyrinth. Much stronger than the ones in Masteria. When approached, it makes a sound before using its attack which causes a red root to grow onto the player.
A cat found along the beach between Berry and San Commerci. Attacks with its claws.
This Scarlion is piloting a tiny propeller plane. It attacks by firing a missile at you. Found in Malaysia's Fantasy Theme Park.
A white goat found along Shanghai's Rural Area, near Yu Garden.
A black goat found along Shanghai's Rural Area, near Yu Garden. It attacks by kicking dust at you.
A ghost holding a stoplight found along Shanghai's Nanjing Road, near Yu Garden. It attacks by slamming its stoplight into the ground.

A winged beast found in the Shadow Veil Forest. Their magic attack can prove to be annoying to players as it can super knockback. Like the Typhon from Crimsonwood Keep, and unlike the one from Crimsonheart Castle, this one can fly.
A living, moving tree found in the Shadow Veil Forest's Labyrinth. Much stronger than the ones in Masteria.

A viking ship monster, similar to Spirit Vikings, but it's much smaller. Vikerola has an HP regain skill, but it only recovers about 1k HP. It attacks by creating a small tidal wave to hit you. Found in Malaysia's Fantasy Theme Park.
A cow found along Shanghai's Rural Area, near Yu Garden.
A plow ox found along Shanghai's Rural Area, near Yu Garden. It attacks by breathing a strong gust of air out of its nose.
Summoned by Von Leon. If you don't kill it fast enough, Von Leon will consume these and recover 3 million HP for each one consumed.

A zombie with a mohawk, found in the Forest of Dead Trees area of El Nath. It has two attacks: it can scratch you, and breathe poison breath on you, which can poison, so bring antidotes or All Cures if you can't kill these quickly.

Another statue that has come to life. Attacks by swinging its axe at you. Found in Golden Temple's Goblin Caves. Its appearance is based on that of a Demon from the Thailand National epic, the Ramakien.
A corrupted Kentaurus found in Leafre's past.

Victor was one of the 3 Heliseum Guardians, along with Treglow and Edea. He was well known for being an excellent painter, being a descendant of a long line of talented artists. His paintings had a huge influence on the Nova people. He fell deeply in love with a woman, who was dead. He would paint paintings of her. Then, one day, he learned about a magical canvas that brought art to life. Magnus had Darmoor retrieve the canvas, and then used it to beguile Victor into becoming his servant. Victor, no longer caring about the Novans, took this chance to bring the woman he loved to life. When Victor finished painting her on the canvas, a doll popped out in the form of the woman he loved, destroying Victor's spirit. Pouring salt to that wound, the canvas, which was cursed by Darmoor, absorbed Victor's soul inside the painting and Victor's body became a slave for Magnus. Now, Victor creates new minions (Totem Staves) for Magnus by painting them on the cursed canvas.
Found in Lion King's Castle. Attacks by jabbing its spear at you.
Another statue that has come to life. Attacks by punching you. Found in Golden Temple's Goblin Caves. Its appearance is based on that of a Demon from the Thailand National epic, the Ramakien.
This version of the Blue Goblin is summoned by Ravana. Make sure you kill these fast, because they can heal Ravana and all other surrounding enemies for 19 million HP each!
This version of the Red Goblin is summoned by Ravana.
This version of the Red Goblin is summoned by Ravana. Unlike the one in the caves, this one is not ice weak.
A corrupted Cornian found in Leafre's past.
You must save Jenn's brother from these for one of the first quests in Lion King's Castle.
Ifia must be protected from these for one of the quests in Lion King's Castle.

A boss that spawns at Forest of Dead Trees IV. It can cast various spells to damage you. It can also seal your skills, curse you so that you receive half the experience, weaken you to prevent you from jumping, dispel your skills, and zombify. It can also summon a Coolie Zombie.
This version of Riche must be killed for the Silent Crusade. It has the same abilities as the real Riche.

An immobile sphere of time that has ridiculously low HP for its level. It is summoned at the Clock Tower using the Piece of Cracked Dimension, then killed to summon Papulatus Clock, in a map which requires 30 Star Force to deal full damage.

A steady speed monster. Papulatus occasionally retreats inside its clock, rendering it invincible, which lets it regain HP. However, in this state, it is also unable to hurt you. It is capable of stunning, doing a lightning attack, and reducing your HP/MP to 1, though arguably the most annoying skill it possess is Dispel. Summoned by the defeat of the Time Sphere at the base of the Clock Tower, in a map which requires 30 Star Force to deal full damage. Can only be fought twice a day. Summons High Dark Star and Low Dark Star.

After Papulatus is separated from its ride, it starts to zoom around at a VERY fast speed, but seems unable to conjure any attacks other than its physical ram. Like Jr. Boogie, it can't hit you if you crouch.

The Typhons are associated with wind spirits, and as such serve as elementals of Air. Though their damage may be weak, their magic attack can prove to be annoying to all travelers as it's knockback value is very high having a high chance to send the victim into the chasm below. Although there is one platform were it is safe to get hit by its magic depending on which way you and the Typhon are facing. The TCG item "Typhon's Crest" revealed this monster long before it was released. Typhons drop the
A small Dark Yeti found near the beginning of El Nath's Dungeon. Transforms into a Dark Yeti when it dies.

The Dark Jr. Yeti's larger form. This version spawns normally. It retains its holy weakness and add an earthquake attack to its repertoire. This version can also boost its weapon attack/defense. Dark Yetis are more powerful than regular Yeti, but are no longer resistant to ice.
The Dark Jr. Yeti's larger form. This version spawns when the Transforming Dark Jr. Yeti dies. It retains its holy weakness and add an earthquake attack to its repertoire.

The green counterpart of Ghost Pirate. Accessed from a separate map at Warped Path of Time 3 in Ludibrium's Clock Tower Bottom Floor, in a map which requires 26 Star Force to deal full damage. They share the same attack pattern as Ghost Pirates.

The yellow counterpart of Death Teddy. Accessed from a separate map at Forgotten Path of Time 3 in Ludibrium's Clock Tower Bottom Floor, in a map which requires 26 Star Force to deal full damage. Attacks with a slower moving orb of light, and is more powerful than Death Teddy. It has holy as its only weakness, and is immune to ice and resistant to lightning and dark.

A highly upgraded Ghost Pirate. The Spirit Viking is a ghost with viking clothes riding a giant viking boat. It attacks by shooting a cannonball. Found at the end of the Warped Path of Time, in a map which requires 27 Star Force to deal full damage.

A ghost chained to a giant clock. It summons an iced projectile at you that moves very fast. Since it is an undead monster, holy powers work against it. Found on the fourth map of the right side path of Ludibrium's Clock Tower Bottom Floor, the Forgotten Path of Time, in a map which requires 27 Star Force to deal full damage.
An adult mother monkey that's protecting her baby. When provoked, the baby monkey dashes into you and scratches you. Found in Golden Temple.

The boss of the Kentauri, located in a Mystic Gate at The Area of Black Kentaurus. It can attack by smashing its hammer into the ground, and stomping the ground (watch out for the area warning). It can also raise its Weapon Attack.

A Yeti carrying a Pepe around in a cart. Once their combined HP runs out, they separate and becomes able to be defeated. Their main method of attack is the Yeti's ground pound, and, as usual, jumping evades it. Located at Sharp Cliff 3 in El Nath's Dungeon.
Appears once it is separated from the Pepe.
Appears once it is separated from the Yeti.
A red reindeer found in Lion King's Castle. Attacks by hitting you with its spear 3 times.
A golden bee that spawns when a certain number of monsters is killed at the Lion King's Rose Garden.

A larger counterpart to the Spirit Viking. Accessed from a separate map at Warped Path of Time 4 in Ludibrium's Clock Tower Bottom Floor, in a map which requires 27 Star Force to deal full damage. With a cannon magic attack and a large touch damage radius, they can be quite dangerous. According to the Papulatus quests, They followed Papulatus from the other "Dimension."

An uglier counterpart to the Phantom Watch. Accessed from a separate map at Forgotten Path of Time 4 in Ludibrium's Clock Tower Bottom Floor, in a map which requires 27 Star Force to deal full damage. It is different from the Phantom Watch besides its looks; instead of shooting projectiles at you, it causes icicles to rise out of the floor for high damage. These also followed Papulatus from the other "Dimension" like Gigantic Spirit Viking did.

This monster is slow but if you move close to it, it bangs its weapon on the ground and can change between Axes and Swords. Its attacks have a range on the ground, but can be dodged by jumping (similar to the way you can avoid a Yeti's earthquake), provided that you are not underneath its arms when it swings. Freezable, so it is a far easier monster to kill for those with a freezing move. The left side guardian to Papulatus' layer at the base of the Clock Tower, in a map which requires 28 Star Force to deal full damage.
A white baby monkey, found in the Golden Temple. There's also a pet based off of this, as well as a Cash shop cape.
A blue bird found east of Leafre. It possesses a magic attack that can sometimes cause darkness, so non-magicians MIGHT have some trouble with them if they don't kill them quickly.
Found in the Tyrant's Castle of Heliseum, on the way to Treglow. Treglow was attempting to create an artificial creature when Magnus sabotaged the experiment causing this monster to be created.
Found in the Tyrant's Castle of Heliseum, on the way to Victor. Victor creates these minions by drawing them on a magical canvas that he's trapped inside of.
A dog found in Ellin Forest while doing Chapter 1 of the Grand Athenaeum, The White Mage. It can bark at you.
Found in Aqua Road while doing Chapter 2 of the Grand Athenaeum, Empress In Training. The same as a real Freezer.
The boss of the Hobis, located in a Mystic Gate at Cranky Forest. It has the same abilities as Rex the Hoblin King.

A skeleton fish that has a ranged attack by stretching its body and using its head to damage players. It has the ability to reduce Physical and Magic attacks to 1, but cannot do both at once. Found in the two Aqua Dungeon Maps on the western side of Aquarium.
A red bird found east of Leafre. Its magic attack can cause weakness at times, making you unable to jump
Found in the Tyrant's Castle of Heliseum, on the way to Treglow. Treglow was attempting to create an artificial creature when Magnus sabotaged the experiment causing this monster to be created.
Found in the Tyrant's Castle of Heliseum, on the way to Victor. Victor creates these minions by drawing them on a magical canvas that he's trapped inside of.
A poacher found in Ellin Forest while doing Chapter 1 of the Grand Athenaeum, The White Mage. He can fire his rifle at you.
Found in Aqua Road while doing Chapter 2 of the Grand Athenaeum, Empress In Training. The same as a real Seacle.

A dark squid found on the eastern side of Aquarium, in the two dungeon maps. This squid has a black smokescreen attack in which it spits out ink, that causes any players that are in its radius to lose 150 HP per 5 seconds. It also spits black ink at your face.

A sheep-like creature that resides in the crossroads of Leafre. They are strong to holy so Priests will have much trouble against these monsters. However, they are weak to Ice. It's said that when a Birk cries out, a baby dragon will be hatching soon.
Found in Phantom Forest and has the form of Moneybag.

An evil leprechaun monster that spawns in the Phantom Forest of Masteria. It spawns when you defeat the moneybag laying around. These are often hunted for the mesos they drop once its moneybag is defeated and once it is killed, and the amount of mesos is usually around 1,000. One of these can be seen tricking the Bigfoot boss into attacking players. Watch out for the fire breath, which can stun, and lollipop attack, where its lollipop grows larger and it smashes it on you.
A hawk found in Ellin Forest while doing Chapter 1 of the Grand Athenaeum, The White Mage. It can launch feathers at you.
Found in Aqua Road while doing Chapter 2 of the Grand Athenaeum, Empress In Training. The same as a real Cico.
A poisonous squid with a special attack. It can strike you with its tentacles and it can electrocute you. Spawns with black Squids on the Eastern side of Aqua Dungeon.

Another sheep-like creature that resides in Leafre, near the Explorer Fourth Job instructors' home. It possesses a magic attack that rains spears. Dual Birks also retain the ranged magic attack that ordinary Birks have. They are also strong against holy with additional resistance to poison. Their defense buff is so powerful, expect your damage to be decreased by about 40% if you don't kill it quickly.

A captain of Lord Pirate's crew. Wields a saber which it swings at you. It is a cruel being that has no problems with stealing the herbs grown outside Herb Town and forcing the Bellflowers to fight on its behalf. Found in the Red-Nose Pirate Den of Herb Town, which is accessed from a Hidden Street in the Old Swamp.
A monster from Temple of Time, found in Memory Lane 2. It casts a magic attack by concentrating magic into a sphere, then releasing it. It can also cast a plant-based spell, which is unavoidable.

A living, moving tree that grows among the other stationary trees in the Shadow Veil Forest. Much stronger than the ones in Masteria. When approached, it makes a sound before using its attack which causes a black root to grow onto the player.

A living, moving tree that grows among the other stationary trees in the Phantom Forest. Much stronger than the ones in Masteria. Unlike phantom tree, ghost tree is easily aggro'd and uses it's root attack from a ranged distance rather than close distance, so be careful when walking around there.

A Ratatula riding a bouncing horse. Though it might appear to be stationary, it's not, so be careful of that. It's weak to holy and can cast a buff which regenerates some HP from time to time. Has an attack which fires a wave at you. The strongest non-boss in Malaysia's Fantasy Theme Park.
A jiangshi holding shopping bags found along Shanghai's Nanjing Road, near Yu Garden.
A rolling CD found in Kerning Square, accessed through the TV in Blake's Office, located at the bottom of Kerning Tower.
A rolling CD found in Kerning Square, accessed through the TV in Blake's Office, located at the bottom of Kerning Tower.
A baby dragon found in Leafre's Dragon Nest area, at the Destroyed Dragon Nest. This Jr. Newtie
A baby dragon found in Leafre's Dragon Nest area, at the Destroyed Dragon Nest. Transforms into a
Found in the Shadow Veil Forest's Labyrinth. Fires an energy orb using the odd one-handed crossbow it carries. Much stronger than the ones in Masteria.
A cat found along the beach between Berry and San Commerci. Attacks with its claws.
A black blob that lives in a Trash can. The weakest monster found in Singapore's CBD.
A jiangshi that is visiting Shanghai as a tourist. Found at The Bund near Yu Garden.
A pale jiangshi found at The Bund near Yu Garden.
A male thief found near China's Mount Song. Resembles Genin from Zipangu's Ninja Castle, and even swings its sword at you like a Genin.
A female thief found near China's Mount Song. Resembles Chunin from Zipangu's Ninja Castle, and even spits poison at you with a dart like a Chunin.
A censer found near China's Mount Song.
A fish statue found near China's Mount Song. It cannot move, but it has a wide range with its attack.
A spear-wielding monk found in the Sutra Depository's 2nd floor in China's Shaolin Temple. Attacks with its spear.
A hammer-wielding monk found at the Sutra Depository's 2nd floor in China's Shaolin Temple. Attacks by slamming its hammer into the ground.

A mine-like monster that is summoned during the Papulatus boss fight. If a player inflicts between 5,000 and 10,000 damage to it, or if a player goes near it, it will self destruct, causing it to deal damage to any players nearby.

A mine-like monster that is summoned during the Papulatus boss fight. If a player inflicts between 5,000 and 10,000 damage to it, or if a player goes near it, it will self destruct, causing it to deal damage to any players nearby.
A weaker version of Targa, found in Fantasy Theme World. Unlike the one in Malaysia, this one doesn't transform, but it does turn enraged at half HP.
A weaker version of Targa, found in Fantasy Theme World. Unlike the one in Malaysia, this one doesn't transform, but it does turn enraged at half HP.
A weaker version of Scarlion Boss, found in Fantasy Theme World. Unlike the one in Malaysia, this one doesn't transform, but it does turn enraged at half HP.
A weaker version of Scarlion Boss, found in Fantasy Theme World. Unlike the one in Malaysia, this one doesn't transform, but it does turn enraged at half HP.
A slow-moving monster that can only wiggle a little as it bounces. They were set up as a task to challenge players seeking to reach Master status. Found at Mu Lung's Practice Field.
Another slow-moving monster that can only wiggle a little as it bounces. They were set up as a task to challenge players seeking to reach Master status. Found at Mu Lung's Practice Field.
A demented looking chipmunk found in Mu Lung's Sky Forest.
Another statue that has come to life. Attacks by punching you. Found in Golden Temple's Goblin Caves. Its appearance is based on that of a Demon from the Thailand National epic, the Ramakien.
Found in Lion King's Castle. Attacks by smashing the ground with its fists, which can knock you back a good distance.
A porcupine found in Mu Lung's Sky Forest. It bobbles its head in an unusual manner.
Another porcupine found in Mu Lung's Sky Forest.
A snake creature found in Mu Lung's Sky Forest.
Another snake creature found in Mu Lung's Sky Forest.

A powerful looking monster, found in Leafre's Dragon Forest. It has an earthquake attack where it pounds the ground with its fists, which means you can dodge its attacks by jumping. It isn't quite as strong as it looks, so don't be intimidated.
A corrupted Skelegon found in Leafre's past.
Summoned by Von Leon. Unlike Mini Castle Golems, Von Leon does not consume these.
Summoned by Von Leon. Unlike Mini Castle Golems, Von Leon does not consume these.
A rose covered in ice. Found in the Lion King's Rose Garden.

The strongest non-boss monster in all of Masteria. It only appears at the last map at Crimsonwood Mountain, but there's only 8 at a time. It's immune to holy and resistant to all elements, so it makes for a nasty opponent for Magicians and Paladins alike. They're one of the most dangerous obstacles to explorers.
A monster found at the North Garden, which is the entrance of the Abyssal Cave, where Vellum is found.

One of Hilla's minions. Must be defeated for a quest when you enter the Mystic Crimsonheart Castle and talk to Hilla. Each of the five minions drops a key, which must be used to escape. The same as Black Bird when it comes to attacking.

One of Hilla's minions. Must be defeated for a quest when you enter the Mystic Crimsonheart Castle and talk to Hilla. Each of the five minions drops a key, which must be used to escape. The same as Rellik when it comes to skills and attacking.

One of Hilla's minions. Must be defeated for a quest when you enter the Mystic Crimsonheart Castle and talk to Hilla. Each of the five minions drops a key, which must be used to escape. The same as Headless Horseman when it comes to skills and attacking.

One of Hilla's minions. Must be defeated for a quest when you enter the Mystic Crimsonheart Castle and talk to Hilla. Each of the five minions drops a key, which must be used to escape. The same as Master Guardian when it comes to skills and attacking.
Rarely found in the Shadow Veil Forest's Labyrinth. The same as Master Guardian when it comes to skills and attacking.
Appears during the boss battle with normal Mori Ranmaru. It can heal itself and any monster nearby for 5 million health every 6 seconds.
Appears during the boss battle with normal Mori Ranmaru. It can stun players for 4 seconds, every 17 seconds.
Summoned by easy Von Leon. If you don't kill it fast enough, Von Leon will consume these and recover 3 million HP for each one consumed.
Summoned by easy Von Leon. Unlike Mini Castle Golems, Von Leon does not consume these.
Summoned by easy Von Leon. Unlike Mini Castle Golems, Von Leon does not consume these.
The boss of the theme dungeon part of Lion King's Castle.
The corrupted version of

Xenon's rival, who is trying to bring him back to Gelimer. At level 120, she challenges you to one last battle at the Silo where they were both turned into Xenoroids. This is the last storyline quest for Xenon.

Treglow is a genius scientist who mastered many areas and excelled in chemistry. He also devoted himself to being a Nova guardian, but wanted to create an artifical creature, which was forbidden by Nova scientists. He didn't care, and wanted to push his boundaries. Magnus noticed his passion for research, and decided to use it against him by pretending to be a merchant and sending a spy to support his research, who built a friendly relationship with him. Magnus managed to obtain rare materials from other worlds for Treglow. Treglow was close to creating an artificial creature, but Magnus sabotaged Treglow's experiment, causing a huge explosion in his lab. He was tearing through his ruined lab, stumbling upon creatures that were created, which they were twisted lumps of stone. Having lost all his sanity, he declared them his great success. His creatures (Reagent Rocks) are now minions for Magnus.

The first boss found on the continent of Masteria, located in the Phantom Forest at Hollowed Ground, a hidden street near the Prendergast Mansion, as well as in the Phantom Forest. It has a slashing fire attack and can throw its flaming head at players. It spawns every 6 hours near its tombstone alongside the Jr. Wraiths. The Headless Horseman's

A mysterious Bigfoot, which looks like a reverse yeti, having huge feet but tiny arms. It's being led around by the Leprechaun on its shoulder, so it probably doesn't even realize what harm it's doing! Must be hunted for a quest given by Lita Lawless. It's one of the few high level bosses capable of jumping, and it spawns on several different maps, giving the illusion that it's encountered randomly as it walks through the forest. Be careful if you're exploring the forest, as it could appear at any time!
A notebook found at Kerning Tower's third floor Arts & Entertainment Shops. Attacks by opening up and slamming into the ground.
A rock encountered while doing Chapter 1 of the Grand Athenaeum, The White Mage. When defeated, it summons 3 Peace Spirits.
Emerges after their house is destroyed.
Found in Aqua Road while doing Chapter 2 of the Grand Athenaeum, Empress In Training. The same as a real Bone Fish.
A shark found at the end of the Aqua Road Dungeon with its brother, Cold Shark. It can cancel out your skills and launch a teeth-biting attack at you.
Another shark found at the end of the Aqua Road Dungeon. It can slow your movement and cast an icy magic attack on you.

One of the three Centaurs you will find in Leafre. They all have the same skills, such as throwing their spear at you or stomping the ground. In addition, if provoked, their speed is increased a bit. However, they all have different weaknesses. This one is weak to ice and resistant to fire, and uses a Serpent's Tongue. Found in Leafre.
Same as above, but weak to fire and resistant to ice, and uses a Fairfrozen. Found in Leafre.
Same as the other two but is weak to holy, affected by heal, and resistant to dark. It also sports a dark Fairfrozen. Found outside of Leafre.

A living, moving tree that grows amongst the other stationary trees in the Phantom Forest. You can't tell it apart from the background trees until it launches an attack by growing branches out of the ground. When approached, it makes a sound before using its attack which causes a black root to grow onto the player.

A living, moving tree that grows amongst the other stationary trees in the Phantom Forest. You can't tell it apart from the background trees until it launches an attack by growing branches out of the ground. When approached, it makes a sound before using its attack which causes a black root to grow onto the player.
A monster found at the entrances of Normal Mode Von Bon, Pierre, and Crimson Queen. It uses a slash attack when provoked.
A bat encountered while doing Chapter 1 of the Grand Athenaeum, The White Mage. It can screech at you.
Found in Aqua Road while doing Chapter 2 of the Grand Athenaeum, Empress In Training. The same as a real Bombing Fish House.
Emerges after their house is destroyed in Aqua Road while doing Chapter 2 of the Grand Athenaeum, Empress In Training. The same as a real Bombing Fish House.
Found in Edelstein while doing Chapter 3 of the Grand Athenaeum, The Black Witch. The same as a real Ore Muncher.
Found in Edelstein while doing Chapter 3 of the Grand Athenaeum, The Black Witch. The same as a real AF Android.
Found in Edelstein while doing Chapter 3 of the Grand Athenaeum, The Black Witch. The same as a real Broken DF Android.
A blue skeleton soldier found at the entrance to Normal Hilla. Attacks by shocking you with its weapon, though it has a short range.
A tree spirit monster found on the Stone Colossus's Torso. It attacks by stomping the ground. Resembles Guwaru in a way.
A mysterious egg rider on the back of a dragon-like creature. Found in Leafre's Dragon Forest. It shoots a huge fireball projectile at you, luckily it's slow.

A spearman found in the Crimsonheart Castle. The attacks that appear when it swings its spear and raises it are pretty dangerous, so definitely don't underestimate them! Based on Stormbreaker from GMS's Phantom Forest/Crimsonwood Keep area.
A black blob that disguised itself as a palm tree to attack unsuspecting travelers, but must come up for a breath once in a while. Found near Trend Zone Metropolis in Malaysia.

A zombie with a mining hat, found in the Dead Mine area of El Nath, in maps which require 50 Star Force to deal full damage. Slightly faster in movement than Coolie Zombies. It also does the same attack as its counterpart.
A small dog-like creature found in the Caves of Trial, deep in the Dead Mine Dungeon, in a map which requires 55 Star Force to deal full damage.
A Mini Castle Golem covered in roses. Found in the Lion King's Rose Garden.
A stronger version of Dark Axe Stump, found in Korean Folk Town.
A black blob monster from Malaysia's Trend Zone Metropolis. Its name makes little sense considering it does not poke fun at the standard conventions of "emo".

A centipede that spawns in the 80-Year-Old Herb Garden of Herb Town. It can pound the ground, it can generate poison around itself, and it can create shockwaves to attack you and can attack you with a needle that sticks out of the player.

A centipede that must be killed for the Silent Crusade. Accessed from a Mystic Gate that can be found in the last map of Herb Town before ending up in Mu Lung. Has the same abilities as the Giant Centipede.
Another egg rider on the back of a dragon beast. Found in Leafre's Dragon Forest. It has the same attack as its slightly weaker counterpart.

An evil leprechaun monster that is found in the Crimsonheart Castle. Watch out for the lollipop attacks! Based on Leprechaun from GMS's Phantom Forest/Crimsonwood Keep area. Unlike the Leprechaun from there, this one is mobile.
A black blob monster from Malaysia's Trend Zone Metropolis. This one's rolling a tire around.
The King of Castle Golems. Spawns when a certain number of monsters is killed at the Lion King's Rose Garden.

A brown dog-like creature found in the Cave of Trial, deep in the Dead Mine Dungeon, in a map which requires 55 Star Force to deal full damage. It has an earthquake-like attack where it pounds the ground with its fists that can be avoided by jumping, but can hurt quite a bit nevertheless.
A tiger monster found in Korean Folk Town.
A red dragon found in Leafre's Dragon Nest. It attacks by creating a gust of wind to hit you, and breathing fire on the floor.

A fiery magician found in the Crimsonheart Castle. Be careful, as she shoots a fire bow which hits you with fire magic. She might look human, but once defeated, she transforms into a fireball. Based on Firebrand from GMS's Phantom Forest/Crimsonwood Keep area.

A fireball found in the Crimsonheart Castle. It breathes fire for its main attack. Spawns when the above is killed. Based on Firebrand from GMS's Phantom Forest/Crimsonwood Keep area. Unlike the Firebrand there, this one cannot fly, instead hovering above the ground.
A mobile helmet found at the Sutra Depository's 4th and 5th floors in China's Shaolin Temple.
Found outside Gollux's body. Resembles Ghostwood Stumpy from Twilight Perion.
Found outside and inside of Gollux's body. Resembles Ghostwood Stumpy from Twilight Perion.
Found on the outskirts and inside of Gollux's body. Resembles Ghostwood Stumpy from Twilight Perion.
Found inside Gollux's body. It can cast Weapon Defense Up and Weapon Cancel. Resembles Stone Bug from Ellin Forest.
Found inside Gollux's body. It can cast Weapon Defense Up and Weapon Cancel. Resembles Stone Bug from Ellin Forest.
Found inside Gollux's body. It can cast Weapon Defense Up and Weapon Cancel. Resembles Stone Bug from Ellin Forest.

A wyvern boss which resembles Manon somewhat. The word "Leviathan" means "whale" in Modern Hebrew. According to the monster book, it's said that it hatched from a shining silver egg. A loyal minion of Horn Tail, and rules over the wyverns of Dragon Canyon. It has two attacks: one where it breathes ice at you, which can be avoided by getting out of its range, and where it breathes fire which has power knock back. The fire breath attack can be evaded by jumping at the right moment, similar to avoiding an earthquake attack. It spawns in the Valley of Leviathan, a new map added to Leafre. When defeated, it merely closes its eyes and lands on the ground.
The corrupted version of Leviathan, which must be killed for the Silent Crusade. It has the same abilities as the real Leviathan.
The boss of the Crimsonheart Castle. He can either slam his axes into the ground, or spin like a twister. Based on Red Nirg from GMS's Crimsonwood Keep Party Quest.
A centipede found along Shanghai's Rural Area, near Yu Garden.

The boss of Shaolin Temple. The Chief Priest has used you to obtain a special book that allows him to steal the power of the Nine-Tailed Fox and the Goblin Demon living inside of the Sutra Depository, and you must defeat him to avenge them.
A high-quality speaker found at Kerning Tower's basement electronics store. Attacks by blasting noise out at you.
A monster from Temple of Time, found in Memory Lane 3. It can attack with its fists, and can slam a spear into the ground, which is indicated by an area warning on the ground.

Found in the Shadow Veil Forest's Labyrinth. Be careful, as she shoots a fire bow which hits you with fire magic. She might look human, but once defeated, she transforms into the fireball form of Firebrand from Crimsonwood Keep. Much stronger than the ones in Masteria.
A black blob with big wings. Can fly through the map. Patrols the skies over Singapore's CBD.
A red jiangshi found at The Bund near Yu Garden.
A white tiger found near China's Mount Song. Attacks by creating a shockwave with its sword.
An eagle found near China's Mount Song. Attacks by doing a quick stab with its sword.
A rock monster China's Mount Song. Attacks by lifting rocks telekinetically and hurling them at you.
A bear that apparently knows Martial Arts. Attacks by scratching you. Found in Mu Lung's Wild Bear Area. Just hitting it once will make it angry, which increases its speed.
A panda trained in Martial Arts. Its face glows red when angered, and it attacks by scratching you. Found in Mu Lung's Wild Bear Area.

A reindeer found near Mu Lung's Peach Farm area. It has a magic attack, but it can be avoided because the antlers glow when it is preparing to cast. This monster can also raise its Magic Attack when provoked.

A thieving monkey that pilfers peaches from Tae Sang's Peach Farm outside Mu Lung. It throws the peaches from its sack at players when angered, similar to a Lupin with bananas. The peaches move slow, and are thus easy to avoid.
A book possessed by a water spirit. Found in the Foggy Forest area of Mu Lung. It doesn't have any magical attacks, but it can raise the Weapon Attack of nearby monsters when provoked.

A monster from the Foggy Forest area of Mu Lung. It looks dignified. The Sage Cats were formerly 738,000 creatures, however when they came across the Legendary Being's Scroll, its overwhelming power caused them to become evil. They can cast Magic Defense Up, halving any magic damage inflicted on them and can slash with their claws at close range.
Another statue that has come to life. Attacks by clashing its axes together. Found in Golden Temple's Goblin Caves. Its appearance and name are based on that of a Hindu deity.
A stronger version of the Blue Dragon Turtle. More dangerous than the Blue Dragon Turtle, but still not particularly powerful. Found in Leafre's Dragon Forest.
A dummy boss found in Mu Lung Practice Field.
A former friend of Kaiser and Angelic Buster, he betrayed them out of envy of Kaiser's power, in search of his own power. As a result, he ended up becoming a minion of Magnus.
An amphibious creature that has taken up residence inside a jar. Found in Herb Town.
A slightly stronger version of the Jar, but instead of containing an Amphibian, it has a tiny Ginseng. Found in Herb Town.

A monster from Herb Town. The Bellflowers were once a peaceful race living in the Bellflower valley outside of Herb Town. When the Pirates began attacking, their leader was kidnapped by Lord Pirate and is being held hostage aboard their ship. The pirates, in their cruelty, have forced the Bellflowers to defend their hideout.
An older version of the earlier Bellflower. It is being forced to attack players by the cruel Lord Pirate, who has kidnapped their leader. Found near Herb Town.
The final boss of Lion King's Castle. Image is reduced, click for full size. Note, Von Leon is even larger than he appears here.
Mori Ranmaru has appeared near Dead Mine 3 of El Nath. You must defeat him to prevent him from performing a ritual.
Must be killed when Arkarium sends you to another map. Note: It is like a party quest monster, and does NOT have 550 million HP normally.
A red rhino wielding a spiked mace. Found in the Lion King's Rose Garden.
An enemy found at the beginning of Korean Folk Town which, when angered, will try to kill you with its stick.
Rarely found in the Shadow Veil Forest's Labyrinth. It has the same attacks as Hsalf, but doesn't drop anything useful.

Rarely found in the Shadow Veil Forest's Labyrinth. You will know if this is in the map if the Labyrinth map you're in is red instead of grey. It has the same attacks as the Headless Horseman, but BE CAREFUL, this version of it can deal 50,000 damage. It's best to take it on from afar. When defeated, drops 5 Tynerum Shards, which are used in town.

One of the four Twisted Masters found at the end of Crimsonwood Keep Party Quest. She's quite dangerous, capable of Zombifying opponents, leaving poison clouds around, and summon the extremely deadly Dark Menhir. since she can also heal her fellow Masters, it would be wise to take her out quickly. She's also immune to Holy, and resistant to Fire, Ice and Lightning, leaving Poison as the sole effective element. Her name is "Anagram" backwards, and may also be a play on the famous magician Morgana.

One of the four Twisted Masters found at the end of Crimsonwood Keep Party Quest. Possibly the toughest of all, he has a myriad of formidable abilities, such as summoning 10 Windraiders, Stormbreakers, Nightshadows, or Firebrands, and summoning 5 Crimson Guardians. He has Super Knockback and stun. Be especially careful to watch for the Attack Up buff, which can double his damage. Since he can add a lot of new monsters to the already crowded area, you may want to take him out next. Fortunately, he is neutral to all elements. His name is "Grinder" backwards, and can also be seen as "Red Grin", related to the obnoxious facial expression. Red Nirg may drop the one of its axes (Redner Lv80) when defeated.

One of the four Twisted Masters found at the end of Crimsonwood Keep Party Quest. He can simultaneously inflict 1/1 and poison, which can be quite scary, as well as stun, or cast seal if caught in his lightning elemental Arrow Rain. Watch out for the Super Knockback as well, because you may end up flying into a Dark Menhir or other deadly obstacle. His name is "Killer" backwards, and he certainly can live up to it!

One of the four Twisted Masters found at the end of Crimsonwood Keep Party Quest. He lacks many of the tricky attributes of his cohorts, sticking only with a haste-like skill. Still, don't disregard his contributions, as when combined with the others it can be extremely deadly. Watch out for the Shadow Meso Explosion and other wide-ranged attacks, which just may catch you unaware while preoccupied with other Masters. His name backwards is "Flash".

This is the pirate Twisted Master, found in JapanMS. He is a tricky and annoying one, capable of Dispelling and casting Shadow of Darkness. He can: launch blue sharks at you, a la Sharkwave, spin in the air while firing his gun down, and punch you twice. His name backwards is "Morgan", a reference to Sir Henry Morgan.

The beautiful red-headed boss of Azwan. She used to be a chief shamaness of Azwan until she decided to hand over the city of Azwan to the Black Mage, and received infinite power, youth, and beauty in return. She revived the dead population of Azwan to use as her army. She possesses several skills. She can cast a buff that increases damage you take by 20%. She can also use Damage Reflect, which deals 50,000 damage. She can also slam the ground, knocking any player near her back and shoot fire in front of her to damage the player. She can also heal herself and all enemies around for 315,000 HP, draining your health by 1,500 in the process. She can summon tombstones which deal 50% of your MaxHP and pierces through your iframes so hitting 2 of these can kill you and she can also cast thunder which can stun you. She can also cast a laser blast which will do 50% of your HP if you do not go under the protective shield that appears somewhere in the room. She can also summon Elite Pikeman Skeleknights as backup, and a Deadly Altar, which can pull you toward it until destroyed. Once defeated, she does a quick yell and burns up, and drops Necro Weapons along with other items.

The first boss that you will encounter in the Root Abyss. It features various skills, such as being able to make the timer speed up or go in reverse. It can also move back to a spot you were standing at previously.

The second boss that you will encounter in the Root Abyss. He mostly whacks you with his umbrella. When fighting it, you will either have a Blue or Red Hat (it changes throughout the battle). When he is purple, you can freely attack him. He can change his color to Red or Blue, and you must be wearing the opposite hat in order to damage him. If you wear the same color hat and attack him, you will heal him.

The second boss that you will encounter in the Root Abyss. In his blue form, he turns into a fiery twister, chasing after a specific person. When touched by his tornado, you will be sealed. He also leaves a trail of fire that does 3000 damage over time.

The third boss that you will encounter in the Root Abyss. It has four different faces, each with special abilities. She can change her face any time during the battle, to a random face. All of them possess a claw swipe attack with a different status effect. This one's claw swipe blinds the screen for 5 seconds. She can also take a deep breath and breathe fire in her direction, doing 25,000-50,000 damage to anyone in her path.

The third boss that you will encounter in the Root Abyss. It has four different faces, each with special abilities. She can change her face any time during the battle, to a random face. All of them possess a claw swipe attack with a different status effect. This one's claw swipe seals your abilities for 10 seconds. She can summon the Alluring Mirror, which attracts players and then kills them, healing the Queen. She can also summon Heart Bombs, which explode for 30,000 damage.

The third boss that you will encounter in the Root Abyss. It has four different faces, each with special abilities. She can change her face any time during the battle, to a random face. All of them possess a claw swipe attack with a different status effect. This one's claw swipe reverses your controls for 5 seconds. She can inhale, sucking the player toward you. She can also summon a black puddle, which slows your movement and attack speed and deals damage over time.

The third boss that you will encounter in the Root Abyss. It has four different faces, each with special abilities. She can change her face any time during the battle, to a random face. All of them possess a claw swipe attack with a different status effect. This one's claw swipe poisons your character for 10 seconds causing 2000 damage a second. She can cast Zombify and Damage Reflect, which is indicated by the Queen being surrounded by a red bubble.

Summoned by the Simmering Crimson Queen. It can attract players to it and then kill them, healing the Queen so it recommended to kill this as soon as it is summoned. Ignores Status resist that the character has and can not be dispelled.
The final boss of Lion King's Castle, easy mode. Has the same attacks as the normal mode version. Image is reduced, click for full size. Note, Von Leon is even larger than he appears here.
A monster from Temple of Time, found at Road of Regrets 1. It casts a magic attack by concentrating magic into a sphere and releasing it.
A black squishy slime that always carries a Red inner tube around with it. This one is weak to ice. Found in Singapore's Boat Quay Town.
A fish-like creature found along the canals of the Commerci Republic. Attacks by shooting an arrow at you.
A stronger version of Sureshot Delfino, found at Canals 5 and 6, past the barrier at Canal 4.
A pair of headphones found at Kerning Tower's fourth floor Music Shops. Attacks by firing a music note-shaped ball at you.
A praying mantis monster found near Stone Colossus's Exploration Site. It can attack by clashing its front legs together.
A black squishy slime that always carries a blue inner tube around with it. This one is weak to Fire. Found in Singapore's Boat Quay Town.
A fish-like creature found along the canals of the Commerci Republic. Attacks by firing a magic orb out of its staff.
A stronger version of Voodoo Delfino, found at Canals 5 and 6, past the barrier at Canal 4.
Bodyguard A
A pair of headphones found at Kerning Tower's fourth floor Music Shops. Attacks by firing a music note-shaped ball at you.
A dragon skeleton found in Leafre's Dragon Nest area. When provoked, it can raise the Weapon Attack of all other monsters around it. It can fire a short-ranged laser beam out of its mouth.

A monster from Temple of Time, found at Road of Regrets 2. It casts a magic attack by concentrating magic into a sphere and releasing it. It can also cast a ice-based spell, which is unavoidable. The helpers also attack by scratching you.
A black squishy slime with an octopus on its head. Found in Singapore's Boat Quay Town. The octopus attacks by spitting ink at you.
A praying mantis monster found near Stone Colossus's Exploration Site. It can attack by clashing its front legs together.
A makeup set found at Kerning Tower's fifth floor Cosmetics Shops. Attacks by chomping at you.
A sailor ghost that always carries a fishing rod. Found in Singapore's Boat Quay Town. It attacks by swinging its broom at you.
A walking dressing table found at Kerning Tower's fifth floor Cosmetics Shops. Attacks by slamming its front drawers into you.
A hair roller found at Kerning Tower's sixth floor Hair Salons. Attacks by rolling fast to create friction.
A red skeleton soldier found at the entrance to Normal Hilla. Uses the same attack as its blue counterpart.
The boss of the Alien Base. It has the same skills as Pianus, and can deal very high damage for its level, reaching around 10,000.
The spirit of Beta's weapon, the Heavy Sword. Must be defeated by Beta as a test of strength. He can use Seal.
The spirit of Alpha's weapon, the Long Sword. Must be defeated by Alpha as a test of strength. She can use Weapon Cancel, which lasts 10 seconds.

A huge fish that is immobile. Rumor has it that the reason it doesn't move is because the rest of its body is stuck in a hole in the side of the cave, but it is certain that there's more of Pianus' body that remains unseen. Summons Bloody Booms from time to time, causes rocks to rain on you from the ceiling, can shoot a beam from it's mouth, and has an attack that can bring your HP and MP to 1. This boss is weak to fire so if you're a White Knight or Paladin, try using fire charge for massive damage. Also, this is the

A huge fish that is immobile. Rumor has it that the reason it doesn't move is because the rest of its body is stuck in a hole in the side of the cave, but it is certain that there's more of Pianus' body that remains unseen. Summons Bloody Booms from time to time, causes rocks to rain on you from the ceiling, can shoot a beam from it's mouth, and has an attack that can bring your HP and MP to 1. This boss is weak to fire, so if you're a White Knight, try using fire charge for massive damage. Also this is the
Appears after you defeat Captain Blood the Pirate King during the Commerci quest line. Must be defeated, and it actually takes damage unlike the tentacles during Commerci voyages

This arm is found on the top left during the battle with Zakum. Like all the other arms, it can fly to a spot on the ground, indicated by a flashing signal, and capable of doing 90% HP as damage. During the platform phase, it can clap with Arm 5, firing out a laser (indicated by the ground flashing on the adjacent platforms) that kills the player in one hit.

This arm is second from the top left during the battle with Zakum. Like all the other arms, it can fly to a spot on the ground, indicated by a flashing signal, and capable of doing 90% HP as damage. During the platform phase, it can clap with Arm 6, firing out a laser (indicated by the ground flashing on the adjacent platforms) that kills the player in one hit.

This arm is third from the top left during the battle with Zakum. Like all the other arms, it can fly to a spot on the ground, indicated by a flashing signal, and capable of doing 90% HP as damage. During the platform phase, it can clap with Arm 7, firing out a laser (indicated by the ground flashing on the adjacent platforms) that kills the player in one hit.

This arm is found on the bottom left during the battle with Zakum. Like all the other arms, it can fly to a spot on the ground, indicated by a flashing signal, and capable of doing 90% HP as damage. During the platform phase, it remains inactive, along with Arm 8, while the other arms fight back.

This arm is found on the top right during the battle with Zakum. Like all the other arms, it can fly to a spot on the ground, indicated by a flashing signal, and capable of doing 90% HP as damage. During the platform phase, it can clap with Arm 1, firing out a laser (indicated by the ground flashing on the adjacent platforms) that kills the player in one hit.

This arm is second from the top right during the battle with Zakum. Like all the other arms, it can fly to a spot on the ground, indicated by a flashing signal, and capable of doing 90% HP as damage. During the platform phase, it can clap with Arm 2, firing out a laser (indicated by the ground flashing on the adjacent platforms) that kills the player in one hit.

This arm is third from the top right during the battle with Zakum. Like all the other arms, it can fly to a spot on the ground, indicated by a flashing signal, and capable of doing 90% HP as damage. During the platform phase, it can clap with Arm 3, firing out a laser (indicated by the ground flashing on the adjacent platforms) that kills the player in one hit.

This arm is found on the bottom right during the battle with Zakum. Like all the other arms, it can fly to a spot on the ground, indicated by a flashing signal, and capable of doing 90% HP as damage. During the platform phase, it remains inactive, along with Arm 8, while the other arms fight back.

The main body of Zakum. It is key to attack the body, as attacking the arms will not directly damage the body. However, it will make certain phases easier. While the arms are alive, the body will not directly attack, unless all the arms have been defeated before the last 20% of Zakum's health. In this case, Zakum will be able to charge up an attack, remaining stagnant for a few seconds, and unleash an explosion that does 99% of your health as damage. Zakum will also be able to summon 2 of each minion during this phase, as well as cast Weapon Cancel. In the last phase of the battle, during the last 20% of Zakum's health, Zakum will gain new abilities. It will be able to burrow into the ground and reappear on top of you, as well as cast Magic Cancel, and cause rocks to fall from the ceiling, which can slow you down and prevent you from using special movement skills, such as Flash Jump. Its main attack during this phase involves a green cube appearing, and the players must hide under the cube to avoid getting instantly killed by its main attack, where it leaps into the air and slams into the ground.

The traitor to the Nova people, and a minion of Darmoor and the Black Mage, in easy mode. The battle against him can be tough, due to his abilities and surroundings. The map he resides in has a 5 second potion cooldown. There are also Meteors that fall to the ground, green ones taking away 40% of your HP, and the blue and purple meteors deal 90% of your HP. Green meteors are always seen throughout the battle, blue meteors start to rain down at 50% HP, and purple meteors start to rain down at 20% HP. As for Magnus's skills, he can Slow, with the added effect of restricting you from using movement skills such as flash jump and teleport. One attack includes him rushing at you, knocking you back with him. He can also spin around, knocking you back. He has 3 attacks that can 1hko, he can summon green shadows of himself that can descend onto certain spots, he can leap into the air with the Kaiserium and inflame it, dropping directly down, and he can leap into the air and prepare a blast of pink flames that fire diagonally downwards on both sides, forcing you to stay either under him or farther away. When he dies, he burns up.

A cute Raccoon with firewood on its back. Found at Cherry Blossom Forest 2 near Mushroom Shrine. Rumor has it these Raccoons are capable of transforming into forms that resemble people and have a tendency to cause mischief, particularly with the residents of Showa Town...

A large beetle flying around with a black slime cling on for dear life. Due to this extra weight, it can only hover above the ground instead of flying freely. Located in Singapore's Ulu City. It attacks when the beetle pushes the black slime at you causing your character to have black ink in the face which can be avoidable as it has a short range.

A monster from Temple of Time, found at Road to Oblivion 2. It casts a magic attack by concentrating magic into a sphere and releasing it. It can also cast a ice-based spell, which is unavoidable. The helpers also attack by scratching you.
A mutated Red Snail found in Henesys Ruins. It can slow you and attack you with its whip.
A stone spirit monster found inside the Stone Colossus. It attacks by stomping the ground.
A ghost that manifested out of a lantern. Attacks by breathing fire at you and smacking you with its tongue. Found at Vanished Village near Mushroom Shrine.

A Kappa that has 2 attacks; one of them involves launching something with its cucumber, while the other attack is an energy beam shot from its mouth, which is short range and unavoidable. Found at the Creepy Bridge near Mushroom Shrine.

When it spawns, it's only visible as a tiny patch of grass. Located in Singapore's Ulu City. It stays in the ground when not aggroed so don't be surprised if you bump into this creature. When aggro'd, it will come out of the ground as a big worm creature face-to-face and do a screech attack at you before going back into the ground to chase you.
An assassin found in the Suspetto Forest Crossroads. Attacks with its whip.
An assassin found in the Suspetto Forest Clearing and Heart.
Summoned by Nightpriest Assassin. Attacks by breathing gas at you.
Summoned by Nightpriest Assassin 2. Gives 20% bonus experience per party member.
A mutated Tino found in Dark Ereve. It can raise the weapon attack of all enemies nearby, and stomp the ground.
A stone spirit monster found inside the Stone Colossus. It attacks by stomping the ground.
A dreaded monster wandering around the Hunting Lodge near Mushroom Shrine. She either casts magic on you by coiling her arms at you or attacks you fiercely with a horrifying look.

A car monster that has been in the abandoned Ulu City so long that tree roots have filled its interior and taken over. It can run around by dragging the truck with the forward "limbs." It does possess attacks that can stun the player. It attacks at close range, by digging its roots on the ground and creates a spiky brown cage around you that glows when closed on the player, which stuns the player. It also casts a debuff that can also stun you with a fairly long range. Be careful as this monster can stun lock you if you don't kill it quickly as it can spam the debuff + spiky cage attack combo at you if cornered. This is one of the most annoying monsters in MapleStory.
An assassin found in the Suspetto Forest Walking Path. It can summon 3 Devileyes.
An assassin found in the Suspetto Forest Clearing and Heart. It can summon 3 Devileyes.
A black blob monster from Malaysia's Trend Zone Metropolis. It sports an elvis-style hairdo. It also has a tail and a quest which give it the possibility that it is a cat or monkey.
A bipedal tiger that can be found in Korean Folk Town. It moves very slow, but when provoked, it can slow you, as well as slash you with its claws up close.

Wraiths found in the Crimsonheart Castle. Based on Elderwraith from GMS's Phantom Forest/Crimsonwood Keep area. Unlike the Elderwraith there, this one does not follow you upon sighting you, and cannot fly, instead hovering above the ground.
A yellow slime found in the Shadow Veil Forest of Tynerum. Much stronger than the ones in Masteria.
A purple Mushroom of the jumping variety found in the Shadow Veil Forest of Tynerum. Much stronger than the ones in Masteria.

Yet another black blob monster from Malaysia's Trend Zone Metropolis. A smaller purple blob is riding this hippo like black blob around for some reason. Perhaps he's a fan of rodeos where cowboys try to stay on the bull. This monster has a super knock back, attack so watch out.
The corrupted version of Papulatus, which must be killed for the Silent Crusade. It has the same abilities as the real Papulatus.

A fiery version of Cerebus. Its attacks are much more straight-forward than that of a Cerebes: it fires a ball of lava at you, pixie style. The projectile moves very fast, however, making it difficult to dodge. Weak to ice, so it's one of the favorite monsters for ice/lightning mages to hunt. found in some areas of Showa Town and the Dead Mine Dungeon's final maps before Zakum's altar, in maps which require 55 Star Force to deal full damage.
A fox with three tails, found in Korean Folk Town. When provoked, it can cast magic on you.
A lizard-like monster found in Leafre's Dragon Forest. It slices a player with its daggers, and can stab you with them. The former move can randomly cause poison which can deal 300 damage per second.

A monster made out of sand from Temple of Time. It can be found in all three areas: Memory Lane, the Road of Regrets, and the Road to Oblivion. When it attacks, it comes out of the hourglass and attacks you. It "smashes" you, but this attack is unavoidable. It can also cast a spell to hit you. Although its attacks are long ranged, it's the weakest monster in Temple of Time.
An archer found in the Crimsonheart Castle. Fires an energy orb using the odd one-handed crossbow it carries. Based on Windraider from GMS's Phantom Forest/Crimsonwood Keep area.
Found in the Shadow Veil Forest of Tynerum. Much stronger than the Gryphons in Masteria.
This black blob is in control of what appears to be a spitting cobra. It doesn't attack directly; instead, it plays its flute and tricks the cobra into attacking instead by spitting at you.
A blue ghost found in Korean Folk Town. It can follow you around, but when provoked, it transforms into its full form below.
The full form of Blin. It has a ranged magic attack where it drops a boulder on you. It also can raise its defense.
A blue dragon found in Leafre's Dragon Nest. It attacks by creating a gust of wind to hit you, and breathing ice on the floor.
A crimson red Stirge found in the Crimsonheart Castle. Based on Blood Stirge from GMS's Crimsonwood Keep Party Quest. Unlike the Blood Stirge there, this one is mobile, and can fly.
A rock monster China's Mount Song. Attacks by lifting rocks telekinetically and hurling them at you.
A rock monster China's Mount Song. Attacks by lifting rocks telekinetically and hurling them at you.
A monk found in the Sutra Depository's 1st floor in China's Shaolin Temple. Attacks with martial arts.
A staff-wielding monk found in the Sutra Depository's 1st floor in China's Shaolin Temple. Attacks with its spear.
A blue raspberry flavored jelly juice found at Kerning Tower's second floor cafe. Attacks by breathing cold air at you.
A dragon skeleton found in Leafre's Dragon Nest area. When provoked, it can raise the Weapon Defense of all other monsters around it. It can fire a short-ranged laser beam out of its mouth.

Found in the Shadow Veil Forest's Labyrinth. Like the Elderwraith from Crimsonwood Keep, and unlike the one from Crimsonheart Castle, this one can fly, and will follow you upon sighting you. Much stronger than the ones in Masteria.
A fish-like creature found along the canals of the Commerci Republic. Attacks by swinging its sword.
A stronger version of Cutthroat Delfino, found at Canals 5 and 6, past the barrier at Canal 4. Attacks by swinging its sword
A black blob carrying a stop sign. Found in Singapore's CBD.
A green jiangshi found at The Bund near Yu Garden.
A monk found in the Sutra Depository's 1st floor in China's Shaolin Temple. Attacks by kicking you.
A mace-wielding monk found in the Sutra Depository's 1st floor in China's Shaolin Temple. Attacks by slamming its mace into the ground.

Found in the Shadow Veil Forest's Mystic Crimsonheart Castle. The attacks that appear when it swings its spear and raises it are pretty dangerous, so definitely don't underestimate them! Much stronger than the ones in Masteria.
A grape flavored jelly juice found at Kerning Tower's second floor cafe. Attacks by breathing cold air at you.
A monster from Temple of Time, found in Memory Lane 4 and 5. It can attack with its fists, like the regular Memory Guardian, and it can punch the ground with great force.
A fish-like creature found along the canals of the Commerci Republic. Attacks by shooting a star out of its claw.
A stronger version of Ripclaw Delfino, found at Canals 5 and 6, past the barrier at Canal 4. Attacks by shooting a star out of its claw.

An alligator with a bird on its head. It has two different magical attacks: when the player is up close, Mr. Alli blows a strong gust of wind, stunning the attacker. If the player should retreat, he begins to shoot feathers, which cause the bird on its head to attack in an annoying fashion when it strikes someone. Found in Herb Town.

A low ranking member of Lord Pirate's crew. Wields a sword which it swings at you. It's a malevolent creature, ruthlessly stealing from the poor ginseng farmers of Herb Town and kidnapping Bellflowers to force into fighting. They will slash their sword at any challengers. Found in the Red-Nose Pirate Den of Herb Tow, which is accessed from a Hidden Street in the Old Swamp.

A winged beast found in the Crimsonheart Castle. Their magic attack can prove to be annoying to players as it can super knockback. Based on Typhon from the Phantom Forest/Crimsonwood Keep area. Unlike the Typhon from there, this one cannot fly, instead hovering above the ground.

A giant Grizzly bear that seems to be the Master of all the fighting Grizzlies and Panda within the region. Found in Mu Lung : Territory of Wandering Bear. Tae Roon uses 2 types of punch attacks against you rather than using a claw like attack used by Pandas and Grizzlies. He can charge an energy ball and fire it at you, which has a somewhat slow charge time but is relatively quick once launched. If he doesn't do this, he punches the ground with great force, knocking you back, and it is unavoidable. When in trouble, he will call Grizzlies to back him up.

The leader of the Sage Cats, street cats which gained immense power from the Legendary Being's scroll and the Book Ghost. It spawns in a special area of Mu Lung called "Master Goblin's Forest." King Sage Cat is an exceptionally devious creature, tricking people with poisons and taking over the mind of Tae Roon with a dark spell. His goal is to conquer Mu Lung and defeat the masters inside to prove he is superior. When dealing with him, watch out for the strong gust of wind that he blows out of the bottom of his cloud, knocking you back. He can also cast Weapon Cancel, and raise his defense and attack.
This version of King Sage Cat must be killed for the Silent Crusade. It has the same abilities as the real King Sage Cat.

A boss found in Herb Town, responsible for stealing herbs. It can raise its Weapon Attack and Weapon Defense. It can also weaken you, preventing you from jumping. It can toss a throwing star at you. It can also create shadow clones of itself to attack you. It can also smash the ground with its bamboo sword.
A fake version of Arkarium, which is caught trying to release the Black Mage. Unfortunately, the player realizes this, and then must defeat the real Arkarium.
A much weaker version of the Ravana below. Must be defeated for the final quest of the Golden Temple.

This boss monster can be found in the Golden Temple. It can cast lightning spell, which cannot be avoided. It also casts a ray of fire magic attacks. Its number of arms reminds many people of Zakum. It will summon Blue, Red, and Stone Goblins when in trouble to back it up.

This is the boss of choice for many players to take down since you can fight it in all channels. However if your party to take it down contains many leechers, expect yourself to be kill-stealed without warning. She hates any type of light spell, so shes susceptible to Holy and Lightning skills. Commonly referred to as Anego. Located in the map just before the big boss, at the end of Showa Hideout. Known as "Ahma" (which means grandma) in MapleSEA.

The fourth and final boss of Root Abyss. This boss will burrow into the ground and from time to time, he will pop out (this is indicated by a yellow warning on the ground), knocking back any players in range a good distance. When at 80% HP, he will spit out 3 fireballs in a row, all with the ability to instant kill, no matter how much HP you have. He can also leap from one side to the other, also an instant kill attack. When at about 35% HP, he will start launching poison from its head, which lands on the ground and does 4000 damage a second. When you kill him, you have to wait for him to finish his attacking animation before his death animation begins. When he dies, he burns up and turns to stone. Image is reduced, click for full size. Note, Vellum is even larger than he appears here.

The traitor to the Nova people, and a minion of Darmoor and the Black Mage. The battle against him can be tough, due to his abilities and surroundings. The map he resides in has a 5 second potion cooldown. Every now and then, green poisonous gas gets sprayed in certain spots, preventing movement or the use of potions for around 5-10 seconds.
