There are also Meteors that fall to the ground, green ones taking away 50% of your HP, and the blue and purple meteors killing you in one hit. As for Magnus's skills, he can Slow, with the added effect of restricting you from using movement skills such as flash jump and teleport. He can also Zombify. One attack includes him rushing at you, knocking you back with him. He can also spin around, knocking you back. He has 3 attacks that can 1hko, he can summon green shadows of himself that can descend onto certain spots, he can leap into the air with the Kaiserium and inflame it, dropping directly down, and he can leap into the air and prepare a blast of pink flames that fire diagonally downwards on both sides, forcing you to stay either under him or farther away. When he dies, he burns up.
Summoned by Easy Arkarium. It can heal Arkarium for 1m HP every few seconds.

The final boss of Leafre's Past, easy mode. He possesses various skills, such as seduce, potential cancel, damage reflect, and is able to crack the screen, causing 999,999 damage to all players in the vicinity. He can also summon Netherworld Monks to heal him.
Solitude that has manifested into the form of a frozen sword. Found in Kritias's Forest of Pain.
A perm machine found at Kerning Tower's sixth floor Hair Salons. Attacks by breathing fire.
A monster from Temple of Time, found at Road of Regrets 3. It can attack with its fists, and can slam a spear into the ground, which is indicated by an area warning on the ground.
A sailor ghost that always carries a broom. Found in Singapore's Boat Quay Town. It attacks by pushing its mop at you and sweeping the ground.
A flower monster found near Stone Colossus's Exploration Site. It can attack by creating flames with its "hands" and hitting you with them.
The boss of the Delfinos. Attacks by blowing water at you, casting two types of magic with its spear. Involved in a quest.
The boss of the Delfinos. Found at Canal 6.
Bodyguard B
A flower monster found near Stone Colossus's Exploration Site. It can attack by creating flames with its "hands" and hitting you with them.

A monster from Temple of Time, found at Road of Regrets 4 and 5. It can attack with its fists, like the regular Qualm Guardian, and it can punch the ground with great force. It can also launch a long-ranged spear projectile at you.
A sailor ghost that always carries an anchor. Found in Singapore's Ghost Ship. It attacks by swinging its anchor at you.
A wolf monster found at the entrance to the Suspicious Forest in Commerci. Attacks by scratching you.
A hornet monster found in the Swarm Habitat of Colossus the Giant. Attacks with its stinger.
A hornet monster found in the Swarm Stronghold, a special map of Colossus the Giant. Attacks with its stinger.
A wolf monster found at the Suspetto Forest Trail in Commerci. Attacks by charging into you.
A hornet monster found in the Swarm Habitat of Colossus the Giant. Attacks with its stinger.
A hornet monster found in the Swarm Stronghold, a special map, of Colossus the Giant. Attacks with its stinger.
A mutated dark stump found in Twilight Perion, accessed from Henesys Ruins. It uses the same attacks as its weaker counterpart.
A monster from Temple of Time, found at Road to Oblivion 3. It can attack with its fists, and can slam a spear into the ground, which is indicated by an area warning on the ground.
A monster from Temple of Time's past. This is basically a darker version of Chief Oblivion Guardian, even though it is called "Chief Memory Guardian."
A mutated Orange Mushroom found in Henesys Ruins. It can stun you and breathe fire at you.
A mutated Tiru found in Dark Ereve. It can smash its beak into the ground, hurting you, as well as create wind to knock you back a good distance.

A concrete golem-like monstrosity. It wanders the deserted streets of Ulu City for unknown reasons. Attacks by swinging its arm at you which causes stone to break on the player. Unlike most golems, this monster has no weaknesses.
A squishy black slime creature, similar to the others around Singapore. Summoned by Krexel. It can move relatively fast.
A monster based on the Bamboo Warrior near Herb Town. Found at the Creepy Bridge near Mushroom Shrine.

A once-powerful boss in Zipangu, now a shadow of its former glory. Attacks by creating a tornado, and by leaping into the air and slamming into the ground. This boss is located at the Vanished Village near Mushroom Shrine.

A spider monster that is responsible for corrupting the heart of Colossus. The red insignia on its head hints that it was summoned by Damian, Demon's brother and the Black Mage's recently revealed commander. It has several attacks, such as stomping the ground, rushing into you, and using a special web attack with a huge range, which can trap your character in a cocoon, where you must continuously tap left and right before the cocoon covers you and kills you, and finally it can drop something on the ground that will reduce your HP and MP to 1.
The boss of the Assassins in Commerci. Il Capo means "The Boss" in Italian. Attacks by swinging its polearm at you, spinning like a twister, and shouting to create a blast. Involved in a quest.
The boss of the Assassins in Commerci. Found at Sospetto Forest Heart.

A monster from Temple of Time, found at Road to Oblivion 4 and 5. It can attack with its fists, like the regular Memory Guardian, and it can punch the ground with great force. It can also use an axe to attack.
A monster from Temple of Time's past. Basically a darker version of Oblivion Monk Trainee, except this one has an angry face.
A mutated Slime found in Henesys Ruins. It can raise its weapon attack, as well as create spikes with its body to harm you.
A mutated Tiguru found in Dark Ereve. It can smash its beak into the ground, hurting you, as well as create wind to knock you back a good distance.

An enormous behemoth of a tree that has gained mobility in the destroyed park of Ulu City. It has two attacks, one which it buffs up which can stun you for quite a long time and also shoots a laser at that player. Beware as this monster can also stun lock the player like the Montrecer.
A mutated Ribbon Pig found in Henesys Ruins. It can inhale and exhale with great force, as well as punch you 6 times in quick succession, with fairly low damage.
A corrupted Night Walker. Found at the Stronghold Entrance, and must be defeated to gain access to the Stronghold. It can use a ranged Lucky Seven.
A corrupted Night Walker. Found at Knight District 1. It can use a ranged Lucky Seven.
A stuffed lion that came to life, found in Malaysia's Fantasy Theme Park. It's the first of a new variety of monsters found here. Resembles the character Kon from the anime series Bleach.

A giant bellflower found at the Bellflower Valley of Herb Town. It can make itself invincible for 5 seconds. It attacks by slashing in front of it, and blowing at you, the latter reversing your controls.
The weakest of the 3 King Goblins found at the end of Korean Folk Town. Attacks by charging its mace with ice magic and slamming it into the ground.
A dagger-wielding swordsman found in the Crimsonheart Castle. Swings its daggers at you at close range. Based on Nightshadow from GMS's Phantom Forest/Crimsonwood Keep area.
A stuffed bear that came to life, found in Malaysia's Fantasy Theme Park. It's the first of a new variety of monsters found here.
The middle of the 3 King Goblins found at the end of Korean Folk Town. Attacks by slamming its mace into the ground. It can also create a cloud of poison by farting.

Another stuffed lion from Malaysia's Fantasy Theme Park. This one is carrying balloons while wearing a jester hat, and riding a barrel. It can roll the barrel at you as an attack, which leaves the target seeing stars and can super knock back.

One of two guards found in the Crimsonheart Castle, wielding a set of nunchuks. He can either whip you with them, light them on fire and burn them, or toss several grenades at you which proceed to explode. Based on Scarlet Phoenix from GMS's Phantom Forest/Crimsonwood Keep area.
The strongest of the 3 King Goblins found at the end of Korean Folk Town. Attacks by charging its mace with fire magic and slamming it into the ground.
An evil leprechaun monster that is found in the Shadow Veil Forest. Watch out for the lollipop attacks! Like the Leprechaun from Crimsonheart Castle, this one is mobile.

A fireball found in the Shadow Veil Forest's Labyrinth. It breathes fire for its main attack. Like the Firebrand from Crimsonwood Keep, and unlike the Elite Firebrand from Crimsonheart Castle, this one can fly.
Another stuffed bear from Malaysia's Fantasy Theme Park. This one has a soda machine on its back, which it uses to splash you with soda, with super knock back.
A duck found along Shanghai's Rural Area, near Yu Garden.
A white rooster found along Shanghai's Rural Area, near Yu Garden.
A black rooster found along Shanghai's Rural Area, near Yu Garden.
A possessed bicycle found along Shanghai's Nanjing Road, near Yu Garden. It attacks by charging into you.
Spawns when fighting Gollux's Abdomen. Must be defeated before it reaches the abdomen, or else you will have a curse placed on you that will kill you momentarily after.
Spawns when fighting Gollux's Abdomen. Must be defeated before it reaches the abdomen, or else you will have a curse placed on you that will kill you momentarily after.
Summoned by Arkarium. Since these are immune to physical attacks, a magician is required to kill them. It can heal Arkarium for 1m HP every few seconds, so kill these quickly.
A black blob holding a sign limiting the speed to 80. Found in Singapore's CBD.
A blue warrior spirit found in the Sutra Depository's 4th floor in China's Shaolin Temple. Attacks by slamming its sword into the ground.
A red warrior spirit found in the Sutra Depository's 4th floor in China's Shaolin Temple. Attacks by slamming its sword into the ground.

Found in the Shadow Veil Forest's Mystic Crimsonheart Castle. Much stronger than the ones in Masteria. Attacks by a crow shouting which shocks the player to become a skeleton before turning back to normal.
A coffee machine found at Kerning Tower's second floor cafe. Attacks by breathing steam at you.
A black blob holding a fire extinguisher. Found in Singapore's CBD. Attacks by shooting the extinguisher at you.
A notebook found at Kerning Tower's third floor Arts & Entertainment Shops. Attacks by opening up and slamming into the ground.
A dragon egg on a rock-like monster, found in Leafre's Dragon Nest area, at the Dangerous Dragon Nest. Unlike below, this is NOT the result of the transformation from a
A dragon egg on a rock-like monster, found in Leafre's Dragon Nest area, at the Dangerous Dragon Nest. This is the result of the transformation from a

A truck monster with a black blob driver. When it stops moving, the driver will go under the seat and appear through the hatch after a while. Has an attack where it rushes into you. Found in the suburban areas of CBD in Singapore.
A wolf monster related to Aran's mount quests.

Spawns after
Spawns after

Spawns when fighting Gollux's Head. Must be defeated before it reaches the head. The first time it reaches the head, you cannot leave the map till the head is dead or until the player dies. After this mob reaches the head or abdomen FIVE times, you will die.

Spawns when fighting Gollux's Head. Must be defeated before it reaches the head. The first time it reaches the head, you cannot leave the map till the head is dead or until the player dies. After this mob reaches the head or abdomen FIVE times, you will die.

A large Boss from Temple of Time. It only appears in Memory Lane 5. It has the ability to shoot projectiles at you and can use an earthquake attack. It also has the power to send you out of the map (A first for a boss), but it doesn't use it often.
The corrupted version of Dodo, which must be killed for the Silent Crusade. It has the same abilities as the real Dodo, except instead of sending you out of the map, it can dispel.

A fusion of a pineapple and a deer, formed in Arcane River, a dimension where the Black Mage was able to merge Maple World, Grandis, and FriendStory. Found at Chu Chu Island's Five-Color Hill, an area which requires 100 Arcane Power to deal full damage. Attacks by charging into you.
A corrupted Wind Archer. Found at Knights' Chamber 4 and Hall of Honor in the Knight Stronghold. It can use Strafe and Storm Break, the latter of which can super knock-back.
Terror that has manifested into the form of frozen nunchuks. Found in Kritias's Forest of Pain.

A corrupted Dawn Warrior. Found at Knights' Chamber 5 and Hall of Honor. It can use Radiant Charge to raise its weapon attack by 15%. It can attack with Soul Blade. Be careful, as he hit up to 11,000 damage, so it may be dangerous for lower HP classes.
A blue skeleton soldier found at the entrance to Hard Hilla. Attacks by shocking you with its weapon, though it has a short range.
A red skeleton soldier found at the entrance to Hard Hilla. Uses the same attack as its blue counterpart.
A monster summoned by Hard Hilla. Stronger than the Skeleknight above.
Rage that has manifested into the form of a frozen hammer. Found in Kritias's Forest of Pain.
Anxiety that has manifested into the form of a frozen bow. Found in Kritias's Forest of Pain.
A blue bipedal wolf found at the entrance to Hard Hilla. Attacks by swinging at you with its axe, and by charging and releasing a shock of energy.
A red bipedal wolf found at the entrance to Hard Hilla. Uses the same attacks as its weaker blue counterpart.

A monster summoned by Hard Hilla. It does no damage, but it has the ability to pull you toward it, making you unable to move out of its range, until you defeat it. Deadly when Hilla uses her 1hko laser blast attack.

A monster summoned by Hard Hilla. While summoned, Hilla will be invincible until all of these are defeated. It can scratch you, which surprisingly had a long range, and it can also fire a fast magic ball at you.
Summoned by Cygnus. He can summon Advanced Knight E, boost his weapon attack, and uses the skills of the Dawn Warrior, pre-revamp.
Summoned by Cygnus. She can summon Advanced Knight B and Ifrit, can seal players and teleport, and uses the skills of the Blaze Wizard, pre-revamp.
Summoned by Cygnus. She summons Advanced Knight D, can use a skill that lets her be invulnerable for a few seconds, and uses the skills of the Wind Archer, pre-revamp.
Summoned by Cygnus. He summons Advanced Knight A and uses the skills of the Night Walker, pre-revamp.
Summoned by Cygnus. He summons Advanced Knight C, can boost his own weapon attack, and uses the skills of the Thunder Breaker, pre-revamp.
Summoned by Cygnus. Cygnus summons all the Chief Knights together after all 5 Chief Knights have been defeated once. This form of Mihile cannot summon monsters but can use Reflect.
Summoned by Cygnus. Cygnus summons all 5 Chief Knights together after all 5 Chief Knights have been defeated once. This form of Oz cannot summon Advanced Knight B.
A hornet monster found in the Swarm Stronghold, a special map, of Colossus the Giant. Attacks with its stinger.

A large boss from Temple of Time, found at Road of Regrets 5. It looks a lot like the classic chess piece, Knight. When it elevates, it will pound the ground to knock you back. The ice shards around it are launched into the air then come back down to hit you as a form of attack. It is weak to lightning. Lilynouch also casts damage reflect (To magicians, this is lethal since Damage Reflect damage bypasses Magic Guard).
The corrupted version of Lilynouch, which must be killed for the Silent Crusade. It has the same abilities as the real Lilynouch.
A monster from Temple of Time, found at Road to Oblivion 1. It casts an avoidable magic attack by concentrating magic into a sphere and releasing it.
A tree spirit monster found on the Stone Colossus's Torso. It attacks by stomping the ground. Resembles Guwaru in a way.
Summoned by Tarantulus.
An elegant fox with a cloud as a tail. Found at the Deserted House near Mushroom Shrine.
A dark version of Field Fox. Found at the Deserted House near Mushroom Shrine.
These annoying birds are found flying around in good numbers at the Village Entrance near Mushroom Shrine.
These birds are found flying around in good numbers at the Vanished Village near Mushroom Shrine. Oddly named Black Crow, even though it's blue.
A small flying monster that resembles Jr. Wraith. Found at the entrance to the graveyard and at the Hunting Lodge near Mushroom Shrine.
A black slime creature from Singapore's Ulu City. It seems to be strong, ripping trees out of the ground roots and all. It attacks by swinging the tree at you, which can stun.
An assassin found in the Suspetto Forest Outskirts. Attacks with its knives.
An assassin found in the Suspetto Forest Clearing and Heart.
A pirate that appears during the Commerci quest line, while helping Leon Daniella fight them off.
A pirate that appears during the Commerci quest line, while helping Leon Daniella fight them off.
The captain of the Dawnveil pirates in Commerci. He can use his guns to attack you.

Tengu is the newest boss of Mushroom Shrine, and is related to the Mushroom Shrine Tales content. Tengu faces you as a last challenge before he helps you save Takeno Kinoko, the sister of Kino Konoko, to test if you are truly worthy of possessing the Wood Element he carries that is required to save her. Tengu, unlike most bosses, cannot be defeated by attacking him directly. Instead, you must rely on special quick time events to defeat him; after specific attacks where he lands on the ground, a purple zone will appear, prompting you to start pressing keys in a certain order (with S representing the Spacebar). Doing this will take out a fraction of Tengu's HP. After you complete the Mushroom Shrine Tales questline, you can fight him again to raise your closeness for the Mushroom Shrine character of your choosing.

This boss is located at the end of the Ghost Ship found in Boat Quay Town, an area of Singapore. It can summon 4 Selkie Jr. and 2 Mr. Anchor. It also can heal once its HP falls below 80%. It does very large damage with its Magic attacks. He appears to be behind the events surrounding the boss Krexel, due to the fact that he sealed a portal in the Ruins of Krexel.
Solitude that has manifested into the form of a burning sword. Found in Kritias's Forest of Laments.

A mutated stump with an axe on its head found in Twilight Perion, accessed from Henesys Ruins. It uses the same attacks as its weaker counterparts, except this one can also spit out a fireball, which is slow enough to dodge.
A mutated Wild Boar found in Twilight Perion, accessed from Henesys Ruins. It uses the same attacks as the Mutant Ribbon Pig, except the punch attack will only hit you once instead of 6 times.

A mutated Iron Boar found in Twilight Perion, accessed from Henesys Ruins. It uses the same attacks as the Mutant Ribbon Pig, except the punch attack will only hit you once instead of 6 times. Interestingly, it turns into an Iron Hog when it dies.
Terror that has manifested into the form of burning nunchuks. Found in Kritias's Forest of Laments.

A mutated Fire Boar found in Twilight Perion, accessed from Henesys Ruins. It uses the same attacks as the Mutant Ribbon Pig, except the punch attack will only hit you once instead of 6 times, and it can also throw a ball of fire towards you.
A mutated Wooden Mask found in Twilight Perion, accessed from Henesys Ruins. It can breathe out fire and stomp the ground.
A mutated Rocky Mask found in Twilight Perion, accessed from Henesys Ruins. It can breathe out fire and stomp the ground.

Mori Ranmaru has now gone insane. You must defeat him to prevent him from performing a ritual. He has 5 forms, all with the same stats, except the last form, which gives experience. It now has a skill similar to Arkarium's Screen Crash, which it uses at 10% HP.
Rage that has manifested into the form of a burning hammer. Found in Kritias's Forest of Laments.

A mutated Steel Mask found in Twilight Perion, accessed from Henesys Ruins. It can breathe out fire, stomp the ground, and cast a buff in which non-critical attacks will miss. Surprisingly, it does not exist in present-day Perion.

A mutated Stone Golem found in Twilight Perion, accessed from Henesys Ruins. It can raise its Weapon Attack and raise the damage that you deal on it. It attacks by smashing its arms into the ground, and by dropping 3 rocks onto you.

A mutated Dark Stone Golem found in Twilight Perion, accessed from Henesys Ruins. It can raise its Weapon Attack and raise the damage that you deal on it. It attacks by smashing its arms into the ground, and by dropping 3 rocks onto you.
Anxiety that has manifested into the form of a burning bow. Found in Kritias's Forest of Laments.

A mutated Mixed Golem found in Twilight Perion, accessed from Henesys Ruins. It can raise its Weapon Attack and raise the damage that you deal on it. It attacks by smashing its arms into the ground, and by dropping 3 rocks onto you.
A squid found in Twisted Aqua Road. It's basically a stronger version of a Squid from regular Aqua Road.
Vanity that has manifested into the form of a burning staff. Found in Kritias's Forest of Laments.
A magician found in Kritias's Corrupted Magic Forest 1, accessed from Forest of Pain 4. Attacks by firing magic at you.

A criminal imprisoned in the Temple of Time for committing a terrible crime. It should have received a huge punishment for the crime, but was told from birth that its crimes could not be redeemed and was ordered by Goddess Rhinne to be incarcerated on the Path of Oblivion. Rhinne cast the order with the intention of causing the sparks of oblivion to erase Lyka's crimes... Unfortunately, Lyka's aggression seems to have increased over time, causing all the guards and administrators of the Temple to tremble in fear.
The corrupted version of Lyka, which must be killed for the Silent Crusade. It has the same abilities as the real Lyka.
Appears in the Hallowed Ground of Dawn. It drops the Dawn Stone which is needed to make a Dream Key to enter Cygnus's Garden.
The lowest ranked ninja found in Zipangu's Ninja Castle. It has a short ranged slash attack. Mysteriously, it changes into a wooden doll upon death.
A small blue toad summoned by Emperor Toad in Zipangu's Ninja Castle. It can attack by stomping the ground.
A corrupted Blaze Wizard. Found at Knight District 1. It can use a close ranged Fire Pillar attack which causes the player to be have a pillar on their face and explodes causing damage.

The fully awakened form of Krexel. It's so massive that it doesn't just fill the map, it IS the map. A party fighting Krexel will actually have to stand on parts of its body to attack. Has a number of dangerous attacks such as lightning coming down which shocks the player, a common maple leaf attack which summons a huge root attack to grow out of the player. Has the ability to use weapon cancel and magic cancel buffs. Click on

The final form of Krexel. It's so massive that it doesn't just fill the map, it IS the map. A party fighting Krexel will actually have to stand on parts of its body to attack. After the fight has gone on for some time, Krexel loses an eye, but that only makes the battle that much more fierce. Can summon Bacal and has a number of dangerous attacks.Has a number of dangerous attacks. It can summon lightning coming down which shocks the player, a common maple leaf attack which summons a huge root attack to grow out of the player. Has the ability to use weapon cancel and magic cancel buffs. It also gains the ability to use seal on you so be sure to have all cures. Krexel is strong against all elements except Dark. Click on

The final boss of Leafre's Past. He possesses various skills, such as seduce, potential cancel, damage reflect, and is able to crack the screen, causing 999,999 damage to all players in the vicinity. He can also summon Netherworld Monks, which prove to be a pain without a magician that can kill them fast. He can also can banish you to a dark room, where you must defeat a clone of yourself and exit using the portal on the right.

One of two guards found in the Crimsonheart Castle, wielding a spear. He can either jab at you with it, twirl it in the air to cause lightning to strike you, or spin like a twister, a la Red Nirg. Gives 20% party bonus experience per party member. Based on Azure Ocelot from GMS's Phantom Forest/Crimsonwood Keep area.
Found inside Gollux's body. Get too close and it will spread its roots out onto the player.
Found inside Gollux's body. Get too close and it will spread its roots out onto the player.
Found inside Gollux's body. Get too close and it will spread its roots out onto the player.
Summoned by Gollux's left and right shoulders. Resembles Ghostwood Stumpy from Twilight Perion.
Summoned by Gollux's left and right shoulders. Resembles Ghostwood Stumpy from Twilight Perion.
Found outside Gollux's body.
The corrupted version of Pianus, which must be killed for the Silent Crusade. It has the same abilities as the real Pianus.
A minion summoned by Chaos Zakum. It can stun and raise the weapon attack of anything nearby.
A minion summoned by Chaos Zakum. It can fly, but cannot fight back.
A minion summoned by Chaos Zakum. It can fly, as well as cast a lightning-based magic spell on you, dealing 10% of your max HP as damage.
A minion summoned by Chaos Zakum. It can fly, as well as cast a lightning-based magic spell on you, dealing 10% of your max HP as damage.
A minion summoned by Chaos Zakum. It can fly, as well as cast an ice-based magic spell on you, dealing 10% of your max HP as damage.

The remains of a defeated Chaos Ooparts. It can fly, and has the ability to self-destruct like the Darkstar, summoned by Papulatus, and Bloody Boom, summoned by Pianus, but only at 20,000 HP or lower. If it self-destructs, it deals 10% of your max HP as damage.
Summoned by Pink Bean. It can use Cancel Weapon Attack.
This boss form is inanimate and will not damage you. However it will transform into the first form if a Fantasy Spirit Doll is offered.

This is the first form of the Targa Boss. It has a wide range of attacks in which it can charge at you. It can also roar, throws its own head and fires a laser like attack from its mouth (indicated when it uses balloons to fly upwards when charging). It can also cast Cancel Weapon and Magic Attack. Other than this, it is resistant to fire but weak to ice.
Once the first form of the Targa Boss is killed, this form is summoned. Its offensive and defensive power have increased compared to the first form, otherwise it retains its old abilities.

Once the Angry Targa has been killed, this form is summoned. It gains a boost in both its offensive and defensive capabilities proving to be more formidable compared to its previous forms. Other than that, its abilities remain the same. Once this form is killed, two black blobs controlling the boss will fall out. It also drops the Targa Hat, which surpassed Zakum Helm's stats.
This boss form is inanimate and will not damage you. However it will transform into the first form if a Fantasy Spirit Doll is offered.

This is the first form of the Scarlion Boss. It has a wide range of attacks in which it can swipe at you, squash you, summon a black blob driving a mini cart to ram you and chuck its own head at you. It can also cast Cancel Weapon and Magic Attack. It is resistant to ice but weak to fire.
Once the first form of the Scarlion Boss is killed, this form is summoned. Its offensive and defensive power have increased compared to the first form, otherwise it retains its old abilities.

Once the Angry Scarlion Boss has been killed, this form is summoned. It gains a boost in both its offensive and defensive capabilities proving to be more formidable compared to its previous forms. Other than that, its abilities remain the same. Once this form is killed, two black blobs controlling the boss will fall out. It also drops the Scarlion Boss Hat, which surpassed Zakum Helm's stats.
The leader of the jiangshi, found at the end of The Bund near Yu Garden. Attacks by firing a projectile at you, spinning to knock you back, and clawing at you.

The right shoulder of Gollux, the boss of Tynerum, a spirit corrupted to the point of no return. It can summon Conjured Veilpreys to assist it. It can also cast Damage Reflect that deals 100,000 damage, as well as Avoid Armor, which makes all non-critical attacks miss. It can cause super knockback 30% damage, summon spikes on the ground, causing stun and 30% damage (60% if you are on 2 spikes). It can also lay out its branches across it, and you must climb on top of it to avoid the KO on the platform below branches.

The left shoulder of Gollux, the boss of Tynerum, a spirit corrupted to the point of no return. It can summon Conjured Veilpreys to assist it. It can also cast Damage Reflect that deals 100,000 damage, as well as Avoid Armor, which makes all non-critical attacks miss. It can cause super knockback 30% damage, summon spikes on the ground, causing stun and 30% damage (60% if you are on 2 spikes). It can also lay out its branches across it, and you must climb on top of it to avoid the KO on the platform below branches.

The abdomen of Gollux, the boss of Tynerum, a spirit corrupted to the point of no return. It can cast Avoid Armor, which makes all non-critical attacks miss. It has attacks that deal 50% damage. Depending on which crystal glows, the attack will hit in that direction. It appears alongside Corrupted Veilstones 1 and 2, which place a death curse you upon coming into contact with the abdomen. There are different mists that can bind the player for few seconds dealing 50% of your maxHp and also a deadly mist that causes the player to be seduced similar to the Crimson Queen's mirror which can't be dispelled and the player will die when coming into contact with the abdomen. It also can summon roots on the floor which have a warning on the floor before coming up, if caught by it, it creates a cocoon and the player must tap left and right fast before the the cocoon closes the player or else it will instantly kill the player. It's even larger than it appears on Strategy Wiki.

The boss of Tynerum, a spirit corrupted to the point of no return. Its difficulty depends on how many of its CORE body parts (shoulders and abdomen) you defeat. Once you enter the map, the difficulty is set. It breathes out purple gas dealing 50% damage. It can open its mouth and suck up everything in front of the direction it's facing, causing you to walk toward it and die upon touching the head, similar to the Crimson Queen's mirror (this attack can be disabled when you defeat the abdomen). It can use its hands to KO you (this can be disabled depending on which shoulders you defeat; if you defeat one, only one hand can appear, if you defeat both, neither will appear). It appears alongside Corrupted Veilstones 3 and 4, which place a death curse you upon coming into contact 5 times with the head. It's even larger than it appears on Strategy Wiki.

The jaw is now destroyed, and the eyes are the center of the attacks now. It can cast a curse on you that reverses your directions, and explodes after about 10 seconds. It has 1 hit KO skills and skills that deal 30%~40% damage. It appears alongside Corrupted Veilstones 3 and 4, which place a death curse you upon coming into contact 5 times with the head.It's even larger than it appears on Strategy Wiki.

The eyes are now destroyed, and the crystal is the center of the attacks now. It can cast Avoid Armor, which makes all non-critical attacks miss. It has an attack that deals 30%~40% damage, and can super knockback. It appears alongside Corrupted Veilstones 3 and 4, which place a death curse you upon coming into contact 5 times with the head. Once you defeat the head, you have defeated Gollux. It's even larger than it appears on Strategy Wiki.

This is the first preliminary boss before you fight the real Horned Tail. This Head is Ice Based and will use many Ice skills. It can also summon Wyverns, and can cause a new Status Aliment called "Seduce" which can be countered with the use of Heros Will or having the leader of the group hang onto the rope within the room so it cannot move while Seduce is in effect. Can also make itself immune to Physical/Magical attacks for a short time like Zakum.

This is the 2nd preliminary boss before you fight the real Horned Tail. This head is Lightning Based and will use many Lightning based attacks with the same effects of the last preliminary head. It can also summon Wyverns and cause Seduce. Can also make itself immune to Physical/Magical attacks for a short time like Zakum.
This is the Left Huge Head of HornTail, in a smaller, more compact form to fit inside the room. It has the same abilities as the Huge Head, minus being able to Seduce.
The strongest of Horntail's heads. This head is Fire element. It also has the ability to be resistant to Magic or Physical attacks.
This is the Right Huge Head of HornTail,in a smaller, more compact form to fit inside the room. It has the same abilities as the Huge Head, minus being able to Seduce.
This part of Horned Tail has the ability to drain 3,000 mana every time it attacks. It also increases the Weapon Attack of the entire Body and has the very annoying Seduce Ability.

This part of Horned Tail has the ability to drain 3,000 mana every time it attacks. It also increases the Magic Attack of the entire Body and has the very annoying Seduce Ability. It can also cause your abilities to be sealed and can cause Darkness.

This part of Horned Tail can heal HP and MP for all parts of the Body. Its additional abilities are, it can summon 2 Green Cornian and Dark Cornian, and it has the ability to raise the weapon defense and magic defense of the entire body.
It has a stomp attack which knocks you back to the wall, and another Stomp ability which can cause 2 second stun.

It has an earthquake attack. It lifts up its tail and slams it into the ground. You must jump to avoid it. It also has a poison mist attack which is created by farting. Suggested to take this out with the legs since its just as deadly as the legs.

The beautiful red-headed boss of Azwan, at her full power. She can cast a buff that increases damage you take by 20%. She can also use Damage Reflect, which deals 50,000 damage. She can also heal herself and all enemies around for 9,500,000 HP, draining your health by 10,000 in the process. She can also slam the ground, knocking any player near her back and shoot fire in front of her to damage the player. She can also Dispel your buffs, Zombify, Seduce, and lock your potential abilities. Her deadliest skill is locking up a random player in a cage, healing her for 63,000,000 HP, and killing the targeted player unless the cage is destroyed fast enough. The caged player duration lasts about 30 seconds before it kills the player. This is no easy task, since the cage requires normal attacks which does a fixed damage 99,999 damage, and has 14,400,000 HP. She can summon tombstones which deal 50% of your MaxHP and pierces through your iframes so hitting 2 of these can kill you and she can also cast thunder which can stun you. She can also cast a laser blast which will 1hko you if you do not go under the protective shield that appears somewhere in the room. She can also summon Pikeman Skeleknights and Bloodfangs as backup, and a Deadly Altar, which can pull you toward it until destroyed. She also has the ability to take people's souls upon death which give her much more stronger effects such as more defense and more attack power, so she can be deadly after a total of 6 deaths in your party. She does have a 15 revive limit which is shared and once it hits 0, you lose and you are automatically kicked out of the battle. Once defeated, she does a quick yell and burns up, and drops Necro Weapons along with other items.

Once Hard Hilla is at half HP, she turns into a gray-headed woman with white eyes. She has the same attacks as her original red hair form. Note, she shares the HP bar, so it's not separate. Upon this transformation, she will fall asleep and summon 10 Azwan Ghosts that you must defeat in order to wake her up.
Summoned by Cygnus. It can heal itself and neatby allies by 21,000,000 and can cast a buff that makes Cygnus invulnerable for a few seconds.

The beautiful gray-headed boss of the Knight's Stronghold. She can potential lock, reflect, zombify, and banish you to a different map. She can attack using a dark version of Genesis which can 1hko you or a full map dark genesis which is unavoidable and takes off 90% of your MaxHP, tornadoes which can spin you in the air for a few seconds dealing 1000 damage per second, flaming birds which deal 6000 damage per second when inside the flames, and a purple ball. She summons Chief Knights, Advanced Knights, and Shinsoo. There is a 30 second potion cooldown while in her room. When she is defeated, she will retreat and can drop empress weapons along with other items.

This is a statue found at the top of Time temple. It fights along side Chaos Pink Bean. It has three attacks: lightning with seal, 1/1 with stun, and a physical attack with slow. Its 1/1-stun attack requires either an autopotter or VERY quick hands to survive. Each phase, this form has multiple forms, immediately reviving upon death, and only the last will give experience.

This is a statue found at the top of Time temple. It fights along side Chaos Pink Bean when activated at Stage 2, and uses Dispel and Reverse Key. It has three attacks: lightning with darkness, 1/1 with zombify, and a physical attack with poison. Each phase, this form has multiple forms, immediately reviving upon death, and only the last will give experience.

This is a statue found at the top of Time Temple. The symbol on its chest reveals it to be fire based, making it strong to fire, but with a weakness to Ice. It fights along side Chaos Pink Bean when activated in Stage 3, and can use Seal, Shadow of Darkness, Magic Reflect, Physical Reflect, and all damage reflect. It has two attacks: fire with slow, and physical with stun (markers). Each phase, this form has multiple forms, immediately reviving upon death, and only the last will give experience.

This is a statue found at the top of Time Temple. The symbol on its chest reveals it to be Ice based, making it strong to ice, but with a weakness to Fire. It fights along side Chaos Pink Bean when its activated in Stage 4, and can use Seduce and Darkness. It has two attacks: ice with darkness, and physical with crazy skull. It has three skills: mapban, potion lock, and seduce (left, jump left, jump right). Each phase, this form has multiple forms, immediately reviving upon death, and only the last will give experience.

This is a statue found at the top of Time Temple, perched precariously over a mirror in front of which Chaos Pink Bean sits. Based on the Goddess herself, it's the strongest of the statues. The goddess's appearance is similar to the genesis and resurrect animations. It can regenerate HP and MP, Dispel, use Weapon and Magic Cancel, cast poison fog, use Zombify, and cast all Damage Reflect. As one might expect from the statue of the Goddess, it's immune to Holy, and strong to Fire, Ice, and Lightning, making Poison the only possible element that can harm it. It fights along side Pink Bean when its activated in Stage 5 of the battle. This boss has 4 forms times throughout the battle, reviving immediately upon death, and only the last one gives experience.
Summoned by Chaos Pink Bean throughout the battle.

The Chaos version of Pink Bean. Don't let its awfully adorable appearance fool you into thinking this is easy, it can be a very tough boss fight. It can summon Chaos Mini Beans, and sports a resistance to Physical, Holy, Fire, and Ice. This boss has the same attacks as regular Pink Bean, and some new skills. The new skills include : Seduce (separate from the attack), Reverse Key (separate from the attack), Potential Cancel, Teleporting, and it can transform players into Pink Bean, making them unable to use skills. Chaos Pink Bean has 14 forms throughout the battle, immediately reviving upon death. The last form, the only one to give experience, drops Timeless and Loveless Weapons, Chaos Pink Bean Hat and Suit, Black Bean Hat and Suit, Chaos Pink Bean Mark, and various other items.

The traitor to the Nova people, and a minion of Darmoor and the Black Mage, is at his full power. He most notably deals more damage than normal mode Magnus. The battle against him can be tough, due to his abilities and surroundings. The map he resides in has a 5 second potion cooldown. Every now and then, green poisonous gas gets sprayed in certain spots, preventing movement or the use of potions for around 5-10 seconds. There are also Meteors that fall to the ground, green ones taking away 50% of your HP, and the blue and purple meteors killing you in one hit. As for Magnus's skills, he can Slow, with the added effect of restricting you from using movement skills such as flash jump and teleport. He can also Zombify. One attack includes him rushing at you, knocking you back with him. He can also spin around, knocking you back. He has 3 attacks that can 1hko, he can summon green shadows of himself that can descend onto certain spots, he can leap into the air with the Kaiserium and inflame it, dropping directly down, and he can leap into the air and prepare a blast of pink flames that fire diagonally downwards on both sides, forcing you to stay either under him or farther away. When he dies, he burns up.

The Chaos version of Pierre. He possess the same attacks and skills as his weaker counterpart. When fighting it, you will either have a Blue or Red Hat (it changes throughout the battle). When he is purple, you can freely attack him. He can change his color to Red or Blue, and you must be wearing the opposite hat in order to damage him. If you wear the same color hat and attack him, you will heal him. Chaos Pierre has the ability to transform into both Blue and Red Pierre at the same time.
The Chaos version of Red Pierre. He possess the same attacks and skills as his weaker counterpart. In his red form, he can teleport, and strike with a 1 hit kill attack right afterwards.

The Chaos version of Blue Pierre. He possess the same attacks and skills as his weaker counterpart. In his blue form, he turns into a fiery twister, chasing after a specific person. When touched by his tornado, you will be sealed. He also leaves a trail of fire that does 3000 damage over time.

The Chaos version of Von Bon. It features the same skill as its weaker counterpart, such as being able to make the timer speed up or go in reverse. It can also move back to a spot you were standing at previously. Chaos Von Bon can use the skill Space-Time Collapse, meaning he summons a crack and you must enter the crack and defeat the monster inside before the screen cracks dealing instant KO to everyone inside the dimension, outside the dimension, or in the garden. In addition, Chaos Von Bon has meteorites similar to those of Magnus and uses them with it reaches a certain amount of health.
The disembodied form of Chaos Von Bon found inside the summoned dimension of Space-Time Collapse. If you do not kill this clone quickly, the screen will crack and every party member will be killed.

The Chaos version of the Crimson Queen. It has four different faces, each with special abilities. She can change her face any time during the battle, to a random face. All of them possess a claw swipe attack with a different status effect. This one's claw swipe blinds the screen for 5 seconds. She can also take a deep breath and breathe fire in her direction, doing 80,000 damage which is dispersed evenly to anyone in her path. In addition, she can cast a burn spell dealing 4,000 damage per second, adds on if she keeps recasting it. The only way to remove this burn is to allow Crimson Queen to use her purple fire attack on you.

The Chaos version of the Crimson Queen. It has four different faces, each with special abilities. She can change her face any time during the battle, to a random face. All of them possess a claw swipe attack with a different status effect. This one's claw swipe seals your abilities for 10 seconds. She can summon the Alluring Mirror, which attracts players and then kills them, healing the Queen. She can also summon Heart Bombs, which explode for 30% of your HP, each.

The Chaos version of the Crimson Queen. It has four different faces, each with special abilities. She can change her face any time during the battle, to a random face. All of them possess a claw swipe attack with a different status effect. This one's claw swipe reverses your controls for 5 seconds. She can also inhale, pulling you toward her and killing you if you get too close. She can also summon a black puddle, which slows your movement and attack speed and deals damage over time.

A flying red robot that follows you upon entering a map. Moves very slowly, but does 15% HP touch damage. Found on the Skyline, Black Heaven Deck, and the Black Heaven Interior near Edelstein's Scrapyard.

A fusion of a pineapple and a deer, formed in Arcane River, a dimension where the Black Mage was able to merge Maple World, Grandis, and FriendStory. Found at Chu Chu Island's Five-Color Hill, an area which requires 100 Arcane Power to deal full damage. Attacks by charging into you.

A fusion of a banana and a ewe (a female sheep), formed in Arcane River, a dimension where the Black Mage was able to merge Maple World, Grandis, and FriendStory. Found at Chu Chu Island's Five-Color Hill, an area which requires 100 Arcane Power to deal full damage. Attacks by slamming its front legs into you.

A purple version of Pianus found in Twisted Aqua Road, and a stronger version of Pianus that can also summon Bloody Booms and uses same skills as a normal Pianus, however her HP is pretty weak for her level, thus making it the weakest level 210 boss in the game. She also claims she is queen of the seas, as evidenced by her text bubbles. Unlike Pianus, however, Antoinette is an area boss, rather than a lore boss. Their appearance is also different, as Antoinette is purple, and Pianus is orange, much like the Silent Crusade Pianus. Also, instead of an X-shaped scar like Pianus, it has Arkarium's insignia, a menacing eye.

The Chaos version of the Crimson Queen. It has four different faces, each with special abilities. She can change her face any time during the battle, to a random face. All of them possess a claw swipe attack with a different status effect. This one's claw swipe poisons your character for 10 seconds causing 2000 damage a second. She can cast Zombify and Damage Reflect, which is indicated by the Queen being surrounded by a red bubble.
Summoned by the Chaos Simmering Crimson Queen. It can explode, dealing damage equal to 45% of your HP.

Summoned by the Chaos Simmering Crimson Queen. It can attract players to it and then kill them, healing the Queen so it recommended to kill this as soon as it is summoned. Ignores Status resist that the character has and can not be dispelled.

The Chaos version of Vellum. It possesses the same abilities as normal Vellum, as well as a new one: it breaths fire across the screen for a few seconds which will 1hko you if you do not go to side of him in time. This boss will burrow into the ground and from time to time, he will pop out (this is indicated by a yellow warning on the ground), knocking back any players in range a good distance. From time to time, he will spit out 3 fireballs in a row, all with the ability to instant kill, no matter how much HP you have. He can also leap from one side to the other, also an instant kill attack. When at about 40% HP, he will start launching poison from its head, which lands on the ground and does 10,000 damage a second. He can appear on one side and breathe fire that pulls you toward it, killing you if you get too close.When you kill him, you have to wait for him to finish his attacking animation before his death animation begins. When he dies, he burns up and turns to stone. Image is reduced, click for full size.

Throughout the battle with Chaos Vellum, this will constantly appear to attack you. Avoid getting hit by this, since it will kill you in one hit, no matter your HP. Image is reduced, click for full size.
